hKsdpXemn5KIh6TZWfmD-w.text: Great place for a late night bite. Close to the house. The bartenders are always nice and fast. The menu is pretty big compared to other bars around this hour. I love how you can order breakfast here forsure. They have a huge selection of just breakfast items. But they alao have great steaks and deals. Definetly a place you can take somebody to.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the Breakfast menu....

xj9dAcm1pkLUvhN-Kf1WwQ.text: We came for my birthday. Food and staff are amazing. I got the chicken parm. The chicken was fantastic. Will be back again!!

vSjP8sQspBGtue2FsqrU-g.text: Such great food and the bartender who I order through he is just so cool! Such great customer service and so thorough with his job! Waiting on my food now and I can't wait! I love this place!

ettoNXNdTQgjlAY-INOafA.text: I'm at this place once a week maybe twice on the bar side. bartenders are great food is good for bar food music changes depending on bartender

gWwv0KoGSTScJo02G4Gl4Q.text: I've been here. Late night shift bartender was not great. She didn't ask me if I needed a refill. She didn't display any type of courtesy or kindness. She didn't care. Her and the server only cared about smoking in the wine cellar. Lame. I will never visit here again. 0 stars if possible.

Gw2nfRj-WvSB11AKm5Um4Q.text: We decided to try this new place instead of going to Applebee's.  We called ahead to order takeout and was told it would be ready in 10 minutes.  I was promptly greeted when we arrived 10 minutes later and the food was ready.  The fish tacos came with beans and cilantro lime rice and I enjoyed every bite.  The portion size was just right for me.  My guy had the kobe beef sliders with onion rings and he said it was good.  We'll definitely go back to try their lunch specials,

641L4UHSYgWlbZB62vLvTQ.text: Wife and I had eaten there about 6 last night ,the food was terrible, the wait staff didn't really care if you were satisfied with the service , the food! had the French onion soup and it definitely was watered down. look this is 6 o clock at night that's when people start eating out and the soup is already watered down the pasta was not cooked fully the only flavor to the dish was just the sausage itself, the sauce was greasy, nobody came by to ask us how are meal or anything was and by the time we're about ready to leave they asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, now if you're going to a place that you want good service not something that they fill you full of booze and you don't have any idea what you're tasting or eating or  don't have any taste buds left because of your consumption of alcohol,this is the place to go ,but if you go there to get a drunk go ahead and go I will never go to this place again and I don't recommend it to anybody and there's nothing lower than the last star or I'd give it a -20

e6WCAwNY0ylIdFBb-ZkIlw.text: If I could give this place below a one I would. My boyfriend I came in to have lunch on Friday, June 10, 2016. Our server who I believe was also the bartender was very short with us to begin with. I ordered a French onion soup to start, and a chicken parm sandwich. My boyfriend ordered chicken tenders with sauce on the side. The soup came out within a reasonable amount of time. We waited for over a half hour for the rest of our food. When we finally got the server/ bartender's attention and  he said that the cooks accidentally put sauce on to the chicken tenders. Knowing that my boyfriend wouldn't eat the tenders with sauce on them I expressed that to our server. The server replied to me that he had a feeling that my boyfriend wouldn't eat them like that. He sat my chicken parmesan sandwich down on the table and walked away.  He never said that he was going to refire the chicken tenders or anything. Nor did he bring us to share plate to share my sandwich. My boyfriend and I were sitting there in total confusion wondering if chicken tenders were eventually going to come out or if we were just supposed to share my sandwich.I got up to grab another servers attention and told him that we were about to leave because we were so frustrated with our service. The other server turned his back to me and said your servers over there and pointed to the bar. He literally put his back in my face. I was so offended I walked back to the table and grabbed my boyfriend told him let's get out of here. We left because we couldn't even get help to pay our bill. I have never been so belittled and pissed off at the same time. I will not be returning and I suggest no one else go there either.

PRAH7I-ubMsBTJtjScjgFQ.text: I heard so many recommendations for this location, so I decided to go on a weekday night. The place was empty, so we got seated very quickly. They had some specials on the menu, but we went with the recurring entrees.  We got an appetizer, the bacon-wrapped scallops; they were good, but it came with only 4 pieces. I thought the food was mediocre. My grilled Reuben sandwich was flavorful, but the cheddar chicken was just okay.  I wouldn't pay this much for this food again.   I made a mistake and did not try steak here, which I am told is devine. I might go back and try the steak, but probably nothing else.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon-wrapped scallops appetizer, grilled Reuben sandwich, cheddar chicken entrée

L2xjxap3XmL3abDK9V0CYg.text: Talk about bad.   Bad service bad food.   Okay so we used to eat at the one in Centennial figured we would make the drive here looking for something new. Big mistake  First everything came out at once and I mean appetizer, salad, steak.  Made them take the steak back and of course just placed it under the warmer.   Bacon wrapped shrimp was horrible.  Oh wait the salad was good.  Then bring back the steak, the dried out nasty meat, but wait there's more you would think as it sat under a warmer ( they should have cooked a new one ) the baked potatoes would have actually cooked.   Hell no  They lose we want to test the waters here and bring a party of 20 for dinner. Well looks like that's not going to happen.   Stay away.

JK499EUj4bvlXUpTTFyekQ.text: I've been coming here for 5 years now, and the food here always puts a smile on my face. I usually come in late night so they offer the graveyard special menu. I get the lamp chops and they're amazing!! $8.95 for 3 pieces on a bed of salad and it comes with a honey basil dipping sauce that compliments the lamp chops very well. This is my go to joint when I'm having late night cravings! Also..ERIC is the Best bartender !!

-7SvzXdqwFRL59FO8hWmaA.text: Once again I had a yummy meal at this restaurant last night! This is just a update with a pic...this was a special it's normally not on the menu but it was really good. RS4vdcMXBq1bQ9tYnnFGpQ.text: Good food and great service! I had Chicken and Waffle that satisfied my cravings. Plus my 3 kids had their own favorites: MAC n Cheese, Top Sirloin, a must try kids meal of Baby Back Ribs. It's a great restaurant, where you can dine in comfortably, hang out with family and friends.

kSnBGssqkVm7fP598WsAvw.text: I live near this bar so my husband and I decided to check it out one day.. Now it's one of our regular places to order food to go! Awesome bar food, reasonably priced! The burgers are amazing and I love the salads!

AB5VlxfJ3Nf_BjzuU_jSzg.text: Went in for drinks and to gamble. I went to the ladies room while my friend ordered drinks. He requested a "double shot of whiskey."  With no further prompting or conversation the bartender delivered a double shot of Jack Daniels. When we said that was not our desired beverage, the bartender refused to take it back and insisted on charging us for the Jack as he had "already poured it."  My friend then offered his credit card to pay and the bartender had the nerve to ask me if I wanted a drink. Ended up paying $12 for the drink that was wasted and leaving. I believe the bartender's name is Reese. His service was completely unacceptable. Ended up at a competitors bar and easily put at least $500 in their machines. The owners and managers of Montana Meat should wake up and realize that service brings customers back. I'd rather drive farther to not have to deal with Reese and his rude behavior. Total lack of customer satisfaction cost this bar a lot of money in the future as my friend and I both regularly frequent local bars to play and I will never step foot in this establishment again.   7/7/16 - update On the same date I posted my original review, I asked management to contact me via their website and referenced my Yelp review. I have heard NOTHING from this establishment. They missed a great opportunity to turn around a poor experience. This place is a shining example of lame customer service and taking advantage of an area that has yet to be fully developed. I'm certain that with more competition this establishment will fail once customers have better options close to home.

7VOJEM-JzepELt_tiqvG5g.text: The past two times I've gotten food here, it's been inedible.   The first time, we dined in. I got the shrimp cocktail and a Cobb salad. The shrimp cocktail was 5 sad shrimp in a sundae glass of ketchup - no exaggeration. As for the salad, the toppings looked awesome but the lettuce was rotten and tasted terrible. I have a pretty low tolerance level for a place that knowingly serves rotten food. By the way, the dining area isn't sealed off from the bar so there is a delightful smokey stench that accompanies you and your meal :-)  The next time was a pickup order. I will always give a restaurant a second chance. Once again, the lettuce was rotten in my Cobb salad! I don't care if this is a steak place, if you have an item on your menu please serve it up to par or don't serve it at all. I'm done with Montana after this.

73Wz3QuZsQ9iYM3L1qsTBQ.text: Nice spot. Great atmosphere. 24 hours. Has a huge bar for Monday nights, and a dining side for you and the lady. Cherry is an amazing server. Very attentive but doesn't hover.   Food came out. Steaks were a little overdone. Not the servers fault, so stop taking it out on her. Broccoli was perfect and the honey butter that came with the bread is awesome.   So far it's the best casual steakhouse I've been to in Vegas.

qcr7wXbVYxU9QaIzjTVxtw.text: Found this place by accident and we are glad we did. We sat at the bar service was excellent. The bartender told us about the specials so we had the prime rib. That was the best prime rib l have had in years. I really liked the touch of putting the butter sour cream au jus etc on a separate plate. I looked on the menu and saw they had bacon wrapped scallops those are hard to find. The breakfast menu was awesome and cheap 6.95 for a full breakfast. We are definitely going back

7eZ8Swv_ghT0V3NQa74V9g.text: Visiting Vegas this week for a bachelorette party this weekend and didn't have anything much to do on a Wednesday night after I flew in so I hit up this joint down the street from my girl's house where I'm staying. I used to live in Vegas and in this same Southwest area, and have been to this place once; and food, you always remember quality food!  But last night was exceptional! Our server Cher was awesome! She gave my friend and I some really good suggestions and took her time to help us decide what to get off the menu. I love food, but my indecisiveness will frustrate me. Thanks to Cher to the rescue! She asked if we loved bacon. Who doesn't! So we got the bacon wrapped shrimp and scallops! Both were super yummy, and then we both had our own burgers; mine of course the classic big sky burger with bacon, cheese, and mushrooms. My friend and I were both happy and will definitely be back again. Thanks Cher for all of your recommendations and for being so kind and courteous because I had a really long day at work with mean management; so to come to a night cap and be around nice people is fantastic!   We'll be back for sure! Great food, and exceptional customer service!

zxBL2q3hBYFNlWLC0yFuCA.text: I've picked up breakfast from here twice now, and both times have been FABULOUS. First of all, most of their breakfast items are $5.95. The last time I ordered chicken fried steak, which comes with 2 eggs and potatoes, then regular breakfast which was 2 eggs, bacon, toast and potatoes, and last the French toast, which came with potatoes and bacon or sausage. All of this for $5.95 each. The food is always ready when we get there and still hot when we get it home, and EVERYTHING is delicious. A lot of places make disgusting chicken fried steak, but here it's crispy on the outside and moist and tender on the inside, with a light flavorful gravy. YUM!  It's my new favorite breakfast spot.   I'm not sure about the ambiance or service, since I've never eaten inside, but everyone seems nice. The bar is SUPER SUPER dark though. I've never ventured over to the restaurant side.  Will try it sometime.

x0yqtXRhUNFzjOqSHr1T7A.text: Great food, interior was nice and our server, Christi was awesome.  Great food recommendations and funny personality!  Definitely will be back.

YqndR_cz72kKyNTflXUHog.text: Good burgers fast service all the cops eat here which means good and cheap

KCm_XZSnbKbT5S_i0LAHEw.text: 5 years ago when I lived in this area I love the Montana Meat Company.  Sadly, that has changed.  I have dined there twice within the last month and it seems everything has gone south.  Food quality, food portions, service, speed, friendliness... all have grossly deteriorated.  Montana Meat Company is now on my personal list of "never again's", which is not an easy task to accomplish.  If you are in the area and looking for a decent steak there are few options, other than Giuseppe's on the weekends or the Summerlin venues which are a bit further of a drive.

pE0BY9jdr-QvoR1Tg3I3wQ.text: We have been going here for 8 years and have always had great food. My last visit in June was horrible. I ordered the children's steak meal. They steak was dry and tough. One of the baked potatoes tasted either over done or old.  I am not sure.  We won't be going back.

D5YOEVCWhRcUMeHuLSYbNA.text: low prices, very good food. My mom ordered the steak and eggs and the steak was excellent!

XE-fOYdMQBqdr3Aujvn1jQ.text: I recently moved to this area, and this was my first experience.  I came in and sat at the bar to pick up my order, and wasn't greeted within 10 minutes.  Although the bar was fairly busy, the bartender wasn't courteous at all, and didn't even say a word when I paid my check.  Food came out quickly.  The T-bone steak was fair and needed more seasoning.  I'm not sure when the last time the chef or any of the staff tasted their French Onion soup, but it was gross . . . way too much salt . . . and that's coming from a salt fan.  I'd be willing to give this place another chance, as the restaurant area looked cozy, and their menu items seem appealing, but my first experience was very sub-par, and the service was lousy.

c35f8FumQy5045zFbIir6w.text: Two and a half stars, a couple of things bothered me.  The steak is sorta decent for the price, but it's no Delmonicos, na'mean? I mean, I think it would decent for the price. Read on.  I got the 20 oz Montana Ribeye, the "cowboy cut" steak at this place. My waitress was gushing about how big it was, I told her to re-focus on the steak and stop staring at my lap. No, but seriously, she was gushing about how big it was, and I almost took her home. Ok, but seriously, she wanted it.  No, but seriously... the steak was supposed to be huge? Maybe it started as 20oz, but it definitely shrank. Fine, whatever, it was still a decent size, but it wasn't as big as the T-bone my father got.  I ordered my steak medium, it came out well done. I DO NOT like well done steak. I think if the steak came out cooked correctly, it might have been good. Since cooking a steak well done basically renders it flavorless, I was legitimately surprised when there were moments that I actually tasted delicious rib eye and not charcoal.   There were some decent beers on tap, the service was good, the ambiance was better than I expected. This place is a block or so away from my house, so I figure I'll be back. I have to write a follow up review for it. So far, though, not impressed. I wasn't expecting a five star steakhouse, but if you're selling steaks, you should at least have a chef that can time it correctly.  Oh, the raspberry chocolate cheesecake was incredible. That's why this is a 2-2.5 star rating and not a 1-2 star one :)

UQjLIfTeLHWZk1nY48peBw.text: 4 of 6 meals have been total screw ups however the servers and bartenders are nice and they are closest to home so I kept trying hoping it was bad luck ...

wQFOZU5R4BWTZBH2MLJeSA.text: Not too bad. A local neighborhood spot.   Went in there for a beer and a bite. Not really expecting much, ordered the "kobe" hamburger. Comes with bacon, mushrooms, cheese, &etc. Oh yeah, fries too!  Ordered it MR, Got it MW, oh well? Still ate it and it was not that bad. For under $12 bucks you can't complain.  Menu looked good, I guess I'm going to have to try the steak next time.   Service is what you'd expect. Nothing negative.   Cheers!

QTmChkwYgYAb5EcLXx2xIA.text: Went in for lunch and the salad I ordered was drenched with dressing.   Couldn't find our server to complain he disappeared as soon as the food arrived.  Once he came by he was rude and said that the salad was half eaten and wasn't sure if there was anything he could do.  He took the salad and left.  Came back a short time later and said the manager will take it off the bill.  He didn't think it was right because now his tip would be reduced.  Not once did he apologize.   He was more worried about his tip!

Oej7q2VDh38c1nJPvxuQ1g.text: If you are looking for a low key spot in South West Las Vegas to dine, game, enjoy a cocktail, or watch your favorite team, Montana Meat is a great place to do all.  I may be partial because it is only a mile from my house, but I never have a bad experience there. No matter what time of the day I go, the food is always amazing, and very reasonably priced. For $6.99 you can enjoy a hearty size Steak and Egg breakfast, without having to drive to a casino on the strip. My personal favorite is the Cajun Filet Mignon! Anyone who has been there and tried it will more than likely agree!  Normally I sit in the bar area. The bar staff is amazing. I like that when i go in I am greeted by name and my drink is poured without me even having to ask.  That kind of service keeps me coming back.   The fact that is known as a local Steeler Bar adds another star to its rating for me, however, I think it is time to upgrade the TV's around the bar. I think a couple big flat screens would draw a bigger crowd on game days.  All in all its definately a place to check out if you live on that side of town!

nxP4sm--0zo6qJDBqcNb2g.text: I had the ribye sandwich and it tasted really good. the problem with it was open face! the mushrooms were very salty. I did a pick up order at 1-2 am and i must say for a call in order in the AM service was perfect and promte. The food specials are amazing !

29YR92TmAbDCu44UaRYIvg.text: Great food, great service! Wesley was our server and  was very attentive, no empty glass at our table. The dinner bread was fresh out of the oven and we had the rib eye dinner for two. Big portions cooked to order. Highly recommended for the price. Clean and spacious.

0ZCT7VazNn5T8bfakW_jwg.text: I've eaten here a few times since it's close to the office and they have a $5.95 burger special.   Today, it was not so great.  I ordered the BBQ bacon burger, which includes two onion rings on top of the burger.  I wanted to eat the rings separately so I took them off the burger, and it's a good thing I did.  One of the onion rings was cold, very cold.  The other onion ring was crispy and warm.  The burger itself, which I am happy to report was cooked medium as requested was good.  However, to get one super chilled onion ring on my burger is unacceptable and borderline bizarre.

W1ShmGK1-T-Hp50xucmUHA.text: This is it - the only place within a mile of my new home ( damn, i'm in the boonies ! ) - tried Montana twice - an early dinner after busting my ass moving the heavy furniture and on new years day, late lunch.  Yeah, the place is a bar/grill with the gaming machines, but it's got a nice dining area.   The lunch was decent - very reasonable price ( strange - the menu listed the sammies at prices ranging from $7 - 10, yet the bill was $5.95 - i assume a lunch special dealio but i didn't see anything posted ) - the highlights - the turkey wrap with some delicious, spicy red peppers, the meatloaf open sammie. service can be a little slow post-meal but no biggie.   the dinner - we enjoyed the bacon wrapped scallops for an appetizer. Really loved the lamb chops. The sliders - ehhh - too much mustard on them, so i basically had mustard sliders. MAjor points for having $2 blue moon's - this is my new local pub !

OkrrWxwudTKIN4afWls-xA.text: The food here is mediocre and overpriced.  I have been here twice and both times the I was not impressed.  On my last visit the food that came out was incomplete (missing sides, not as described on the menu, etc)  The service was slow and the food was just not that great.  I will not be returning here.

IhDepRjESj_ucytG0HDuIA.text: I frequent Montana Meat and Iv'e noticed a steady decline in food quality during lunchtime especially. Today was the first time I had been there in a month since the last time  I got ridiculous food poisoning from an undercooked hamburger. this time i ordered it medium instead. It tasted slimy and smelt like fish as if the beef was being cooked on the same grill as the seafood. I had a mountain dew to drink which was flat. I used to go exclusively for breakfast but there is a certain waitress who seems to have trouble getting orders correct and makes excuses when stuff comes out wrong. I used to ask for the waiter who looked like the incredible hulk only not green, he was the best server they had and i was told he was let go.

79Yjnf1ChQDxhuqcjMfEQw.text: Nothing worse than coming into an establishment sooooooo hungry and get the worse server. Came in around 715-730, starving. Was sat and when it was time to order couldn't find my server. Decided to go to the restroom and I see her on her IPAD in a booth. If I wasn't starving I would have left. Old blonde lady stay off your IPAD.

OxIUnG02igATOT2s68cQjw.text: Food was good as usual but this evening the normally good service absolutely sucked. No water refills even after asking twice. Waitress never came back to check on us after food was dropped on the table by the busboy. That is until she threw the bill on the table.

TPTOk0D7lnPi_MvHVl-Jcg.text: Garbage at it's finest!  Nothing like ordering a steak that is overdone, tastes like beef jerky, and hide the fact that meat is bad through over-seasoning it.  The spinach dip was bad, the lobster bisque was watery and not hot.  They ask if you want soup or salad as if it were included in the meal.  What a scam!  Better off staying home!  They can keep their cold food!!!!

uaQwmF-VPHfxXDHvBto_hA.text: I don't know why it took me so long to try this place when it's so close to my man's house. I am still shocked that their breakfast prices start at $5.95! That's like fast food prices! I tried the chicken fried steak and it came with 2 eggs, toast, potatoes and lots of gravy. Sure, it wasn't the best chicken fried steak but c'mon at $5.95 you really can't complain.. The bartender was very nice and the food came out pretty fast. We sat at the bar to eat and it wasn't even smoky or smelly at all like how some bars are.. Can't wait to go back and try more of their bargain breakfast deals!!!  HOT TIP: Breakfast deals end at 1PM

6vrqBSuy47a9mG7t9OgTfg.text: Food and service was great!  Close the door to the bar.  Eating area smelled so bad!  like an ashtray!!  I have a feeling you had to open the door so the smokers could breathe!!

RM-mNwaM8NPchCSFZUQmLA.text: Been a frequent flyer at Montana for over a year, I always order thw Lamb and fries they usually take really great care of me, tonight i had a nightmare experience with your bartender "Wes" not sure if he gave me his real name, but from the second I walked in he was rude and just out of control, slamming the menus down in front of me, apparently he was having a problem with another customer, he was yelling at several people at the top of his lungs and involved himself in a domestic situation with a woman and her partner, after that I was finally able to order some wine but he walked off in the middle of what I was saying , apparently he couldn't wait for me to choose a selection, he barely took my order and rushed off again, he was still visibly upset and slamming things around the bar, after that he continued to vigorously appear to be cleaning around my area, I asked him to stop throwing things and slamming things around me and just please chill, he copped a huge attitude with me and told me I could leave if I didn't like it, I asked for the manager or another worker,  he refused told me to google it, and was still talking at the top of his lungs, then je chose to involve another very drunk customer in our discussion at this point and was ganging up on me with this very drunk man, I am a small  woman and these jerks were just trying to intimidate me because I rightly asked for him to calm down. I will never return.

CU-TfOmvEzioOODSsqGDQg.text: On 8/7/18 around 6pm my family accompanied by four other families visited the restaurant. The power was out in our neighborhood so we decided to enjoy dinner out. Although I was reluctant to suggest this location based on previous experiences it was the closest restaurant with the most room. Upon arrival there was only six of us. We informed the server that the rest would be trickling in throughout the evening. The server seemed 100% irritated that he was having to wait on us. What the server didn't understand is we are a very close group of friends and we frequent many different restaurants together and we have an amazing system to make it easy on whoever waits on us. This did not matter to him. From the get go it took over 15 minutes to get our drinks. Keep in mind there was only six of us at this point. Not only did it take this long to get drinks the server  forgot drinks for 2 people at the table. When he was reminded about the drinks he stormed off taking his time to return. As we were not in any kind of hurry we just rolled with it. We then ordered a few appetizers and some more drinks. One of the members of the party asked the waiter to put the first round of drinks on his bill because he wanted to buy a round for another member who's birthday it was. This would later would turn out to be a huge nightmare. About now a few more people have shown up and we are ready to order dinner. We informed the waiter of our system. Anyone ordering will give him a name and that's who's bill you put the order under. It couldn't be any easier. Throughout the night different family members were showing up placing orders under the name of which they anticipate the order would go under. During this time it was next to impossible to get the waiters attention. He was arbitrarily ignoring or group. This is beyond unfortunate as we understand what it takes to service a group of our size. That being said we take very good care of our servers.  It is now time to settle up and this is where the real nightmare begins. We come to find out that the server has been taking orders not separating them at all. The initial drink order that I mentioned showed up with every drink ordered for the night to include appetizers and desserts. This turned what was supposed to be a nice gesture into an extreme headache as we had to figure out who drank what. Next we try to figure out the dinner orders. Another huge mess. When we try to address these situation with the server he became very defensive and blamed it on our group "for just showing up without a reservation" as he put it so politely. Some members had to make multiple transactions on their cards to settle up all the bills that came to the table.  If this was the first time we experienced this kind of service here I would not be writing this. As I mentioned before this was the third time we received service like this at this location. Unless management does something drastic myself and everyone that accompanied us will not be back. This is very unfortunate as we all enjoy the food and it is very close to home. I would be more than happy to meet with anyone who makes decisions in this establishment to discuss this further as this type of behaviour can ruin a business.

kA-lZXDGG5xpukw_Yem37w.text: Great place for affordable food. Always a place to go to. 24 hours! Their salads are large portions. Steak was excellent! I will be back.

wyhZVE_QtnNdULbfFY1avg.text: Gotta try the Wasabi Plum chicken wings! Yes I know it sounds weird but they are the BEST. Also love that this place has breakfast specials until 3pm (I think) on the weekends. Service is always pleasant and fast. Its no frills but a good bar to hang at.

MPEGEznSwwCVVmKv2gueHQ.text: This location is walking distance from my house so I was very excited to give it a try.   Service:  We came in tonight around 9-930, normally would sit at the bar but the bar was full, which was a good sign to me! We ended up sitting in the dining room. At first our server was quick to greet us and give us menus. He quickly went down hill. After ordering our meals, we told him we were going to want cocktails but didn't know exactly what we wanted yet. We mentioned we would want wine, but had to wait for him to come back around and ask him for a wine menu.  We then had to walk up to the bar to let our server that was watching tv know our wine order and another dressing for the salad we ordered because the dressing was incorrect.  After we received our food we didn't get checked on until we were offered dessert. We also received the wrong wine. Which he did correct.  Food:  The ribeye special is a great deal, 2 riveted with veggies, potatoes and and salad.  Salads were good and fresh. Steaks were good but nothing to write home about. They were a little over cooked and lacked flavor.  Anytime the have steak sauces pre-set on the tables it's never a good sign.  Atmosphere: Cozy and nice, great for a date night. Music was a 90's playlist which was ok being that we went later in the evening. If they play that all night there would be an issue.

z9hRlY5pPiQPBrTnk6YY5w.text: Super good service! Just took my daughter and her kids and great steak special!  Will be back for sure.  Very family friendly and affordable!

UUCNKDUJkW8Nx6Z2QEs4rg.text: My go-to place for some steaks!! I always get the rib eye steaks & they come out perfect all the time! I usually get with greens & mash potatoes! Super tasty. If you're feeling fancy.. a must try is the scallops or the bacon wrapped shrimp! Delicious!!! Another entree I would recommend is their macadamia chicken! Chicken is usually a little on the dry side, but tasty. Their after hours happy hour menu is great as well, chill, small bar to drink and eat cheap & enjoy a delicious meal!

Bn2Th5sG1kpNwBSKGN1zug.text: I dig this place for when we want some home cooking but it's hit and miss I've been hesitating on writing a review until I had visited six times. It's so close to my house that we have come here for that reason alone. I think the other meals are better than the steaks.  It is connected to bar so sometimes smoke can waft over to dining area.  Customer service: pretty good since each time there has only been one waiter/waitress, 2 bus persons and a bartender for the whole place. Emily is a sweetie and she's the gem of this place.  The food: I've had 3 good meals & 3 mediocre meals. Pleasant surprises have included super great bar food, wings, and appetizers. Salads are really fresh! Soups yummy and change frequently. Kids meals are great!!! I gotta be honest that the steaks are NOT as good as they could be. Cuts are thin, fatty ribeyes, and usually overcooked. I've noticed my kids serloin had better flavor than the ribeye special. Temperature can be off on food too.  Suggestions to manager: 1) hire one more staff to help out on weekends 2) please have chef stop drenching the veggies in butter - half the amount should do 3) please note chef that kids don't usually like tons of pepper...don't put it on the kids meals including their steak, burgers, etc. It's on the table after all. 4) please throw away the dried flowers collecting layers of dust - it's grody to look at a flower arrangement made in the 90s that looks like it hasn't been dusted since the 90s while eating. 5) chef please do not use an ice cream scooper to serve mashed potatoes - cafeteria tacky!  I hope they can make a few changes to make me change my three stars to five.

r_qjflMM2Jn39q8KoySx3A.text: I read reviews of the big sky burger and wanted to give it a try... I don't know if it was the buzz from the dirty martini, but this burger was heaven in a bun... OMG The steak fries were great... The price was $8.95 and worth it. I live in Mountain's Edge and can't believe I've never been here before... Way better than any PT's... Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty martini $9 - the glass was good sized

8ojTipqrrdZKnU8ictYh-Q.text: What a beautiful gem. Would have never known about this place had it not been for my couple of friends in real life and Christopher G's review not too long ago.  Walked in on a Monday evening with no wait time. And was seated within seconds by a really nice waitress. Sadly I can't remember her name but it's a shame because she have fantastic service! She was blonde if that helps anyone :)  We asked what was recommended and she told us about their famous burgers and meats. She also told us about their promotion of buy one get one free for the burgers hell of a deal since the burgers are only $8 bucks and up.   We started with an appetizer. Spinach artichoke dip which was so creamy and cheesy. The kids loved it which is unbelievable. My kid eating veggies? Or something green? It is officially the end of the world.   Our friends got a burger and chicken buffalo strips. Around $10 each. Mine was personally $11 but came with BBQ sauce, onion rings and crispy bacon cooked medium. Delicious! Cooked to perfection and the best part was the side. It comes with onion rings or fries for next extra charge. Here's the kicker.. You can have half and half! Whoopy! Most places don't so that anymore and if they do they charge extra. I was so excited! The couple we dined with said I acted as if I won the lottery. Ha ha, meanie heads. Hey, I love my food what can I say. The onion rings tasted beer battered like the ones at yardhouse.   The children's menu is extremely affordable. I got my daughter the cheese quesadilla, which I thought came just with a drink for $3. But instead it came with a order of fries too, which I wasn't expecting. Awesome.   My husband loved his club sandwich. Which he said was huge and he could only eat half which if you know my husband is unheard of. Crazy talk I tell you. So, big portions are here as well.  Customer service was great. They were quick about giving us refills which we never had to ask for. And extra napkins because they knew we had kids   This is officially my new burger place. I can't wait to come back. Too bad it's not closer to my house!

PHKtQDEtHyybdudN_2CPyA.text: Maaaan those churro waffles are amazing, definitely a must try for breakfast! Staff is really friendly too, definitely will come back.

745_w4vWiEIDfyFvpvUYeA.text: Always Perfect.. the macadamia crusted halibut is my go to... their ahi tuna is always prepared perfectly, the calamari is great and the chipotle mayo is so good with it.. don't miss out on their Ribeyes  Their lamb chops are grilled perfectly with this Char taste that makes your mouth watered.. YOU CANT BEAT IT, even the casino quality restaurants close and leave you with their mediocre cafes.. this place is open 24/7 and I can order the chops at 4:45am.. gotta love it. I've brought over 30 different people here over the years and we always left full, satisfied.  I moved away, and still daydream about the Montana meat co. Where I live.. whenever I'm in town I have to stop in.. headed there now, decided I should write a review finally.

li6I9WYLeR7WRXIJUCzd1A.text: Oh Montana what happened??? I've been here 3 times in the last 2 months and twice you have screwed up my burger order (Each time I got Big Sky instead of Rocky Mountain) and now your bartender Brian drops the ball.  This time, I was sitting at the bar, very, very hungry, for at least 45 minutes, waiting very, very patiently for my BBQ Chicken Wrap. However, it turns out your bartender, (Brian) didn't even put my order in? Maybe if I had gambled, he would have paid attention?? Maybe it was because it was the end of his shift and he just didn't care?   I've been coming here on and off since the early 2000s and your service seems to operate in cycles. You go from good to bad, back to good and now in the second half of 2015, the ball keeps getting dropped.  It's too bad the service isn't as good as the food. The only time I get good service here is when Scott is running the bar. He's the only one that's on top of things.  I added a star, because the food is always good and another because your evening bartender took care of my meal. Unlike Brian, she seems to understand that Vegas is a service city, and that service is everything here.

KFKet9nQRE7MueMDmsLu5Q.text: Service is okay- but the drinks are terrible and fake! My boyfriend's drink of choice is always jack on the rocks. Both times we were in there he asked for  Jack Daniels but was served something else. I don't know what it was but... it wasn't Jack!! When he asked/questioned the bartender he stated it was Jack.   You shouldn't lie to a customer... especially if their alcohol drink of choice is always the same thing. You need to serve what you are charging your costumers for! We live right down the street and COULD be loyal customers. Unfortunately we will continue to go somewhere else!!

Ymhg6m3EGZ8l6mCUq5C-qg.text: My husband and I frequent Montana Meat Co. from time to time for graveyard but most recently more for breakfast. Decided to go tonight and was totally ignored. There were (2) bartenders present. No greeting, not even a look up to see who was in the bar. We sat 15 minutes at a table just looking and no one ever came over! The other patrons in bar were seeking to get the bartenders' attention as well. I say if your open and will not service, then shut it down!!!!! The manager really needs to have a better handle on the night staff as they are not efficient and clearly don't have a care in the world concerning the business. This is NOT the first incident but I'm at the point that I won't even patronize again, instead I'll go to other nearbys like Luckys, Sagos or Born and Raised. CEeqqFk4RW1SuBltOiVytA.text: The food is pretty fair for a bar/restaurant, however it's not worth their prices. I normally get food to go on my way to work and have noticed that there are extra .50 cent upcharges for them to put sauces in containers. So there is usually an additional  $2 in extra fees just because they're not putting sauces on a plate. Also, the bacon wrapped scallops which used to be 6 for $12- have now been reduced to 4, and tack on the extra $1 for them to put the chutney and cole slaw in a container. I'm just sick of being nickel and dimed when I'm already paying $30 for a steak but an extra $0.75 for onion rings? This place  has left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively...

BMvbU8Swlt2Mi9tQF-A64Q.text: Food is great! Service is AWFUL!! I'd rather order food for pickup then to actually dine in.. Every time we go there our experience is terrible.

Sa7xf4VAoa-Vz3qxXhb1Gw.text: We came here on Christmas, my husband, 1.5yr old and I. We got the top serloin it was so good. First the brought out fresh,hot white bread with that kind of whipped honey butter that lures you to unashamedly spread it directly onto your tongue. I really liked their ranch dressing on the salad. I got fries and steamed asparagus tossed in butter mmmm. Also a side of chardenay mushrooms. I usually like A1 sauce but I didn't use it with my meal. The meat and mushrooms were so flavorful. I had a craving for steak and Montana settles it. Mmmm I know we will return.

NOZEfTSHaEMdZCZrJJRiTA.text: Montana Meat Co isn't so much a steak house as a typical Nevada bar.  The menu has been tweaked but the quality just isn't there.  I've been four or five times over the years and the steak is often chewy or poorly seasoned.  It's not the worst place to eat but despite how close it is to my house I still avoid it.  Not to say that bar food is ever all that good but this place just misses the mark that would get it to three stars in my book

bk4VTUvtcUd16N5fqokUCw.text: So my hubby been wanting to try this place out for a while now. With friends raving about how yummy the pastrami burger and steak was. So we got a chance to finally make it and so we came in sat down ordered our food within 10 mins. The waitress brought us our app( mozz sticks) and my daughter kids ribs. But than completely forgot about my husband and my meal. After 25 mins of waiting and watching her go back and forth to the other tables we asked her what happen to our meal. She of course blamed it on the supposedly big party in the back, but when we looked backed there , there was no table and that's because they already left 10 mins ago. We were the only table left in the entire restaurant. Anyways they finally brought the food out now 45 mins sitting and waiting. The waitress did apologize but didn't seem sincere. She decided she would take off our drinks to help make us feel better but what's a drink cost nothing really. I felt that she should have taken care of at least one of the dishes off. Considering how long it took. The food was lack luster I had the steak salad and it didn't wow me and his pastrami burger was decent but his mood wasn't making it taste any better. But at the end of the experience. Not too sure we would come back.

tr4u6xT0S5rP4YLawGiVug.text: I have a love-hate relationship with Montana Meat Company. Lunch seems to be the best way to go because service is very slow during the morning and it seems like they made their steak and egg special smaller. I met my parents here in the morning and I ordered it. When it came to our table, my dad said (in his accent), "Why is your steak so leetle? Look how small it is!" and he started laughing. It really did look very small and it was also kind of dry. Here's a pic of it next to my car key: s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com.... I always enjoy their potatos and eggs though; Can't go wrong with those. I was just pretty disappointed this time around because of the slow service and tiny piece of meat on my plate.

TGl0x2BDU7ma90F2hxptFA.text: Love the Steak, and when we had a problem with the food (first time in 12 visits) it was taken care of without question. Will be back soon!    I'm placing this review onto my best seafood list as they have some of the best Shrimp add on options I';ve ever seen. They are huge Jumbo Shrimp; deveined and butter flyed open and I'm not sure what they season them with but I could make an entire meal out of just the shrimp alone.   The tables are a little small for all the plates they bring out for your meals but if you are even the slightest bit hungry you will have no problem emptying the current plate before the next one comes out.

2Qpn8Si8F1MCwckEl210Vg.text: Very good quality food, and the filet is astounding for a bar! I love their French onion soup as well. They have the best after hours $5 menu with delicious seafood, and burgers, including unique pancakes like their coconut macadamia pancakes! The service is exceptional, although not all the bartenders are very social to me. and I have been coming there for almost 5 years now and I couldn't tell you any of their names, nor they could me. As a neighborhood bar, it's imperative you find out your regulars names or at least where they work to show you care even if you don't lol. That aside I can always count on fresh salads and high grade meat!! They don't skimp on their quantity of food either which is nice! There's a reason why this place has been in business for so long!!

0TGFXWR1BO9-988b9FOsfA.text: Located southwest of Las Vegas along the highway to Pahrump, this is one of two Montana Meat Company restaurants (the other is in northwest Las Vegas).   Montana Meat is co-located with a video-poker bar, and features a separate restaurant area. The kitchen is open 24H, the restaurant area closes at 10 PM on weekdays. The restaurant area is nonsmoking, it's not sealed off from the bar area, this is a showstopper for us at some restaurant/VP bar combos but smoke wasn't a problem the two times we've eaten here.  At most restaurant/VP bars in Vegas you'd never consider actually eating the food, but, Montana Meat features memorable steaks, and it has a robust selection of salads, non-steak entrees (e.g. lobster tails, lamb chops) as well as sandwiches and other breakfast and lunch items. We had the thick 20 oz Montana ribeye ($26) which comes with a choice of potato, broccoli, and soup or salad.   Full bar. Credit cards.

lXee8qjsejk7mQpjAMNYFg.text: We were seated and waited at least 15 minutes before we got up and left. I work in a restaurant so I could understand if it was busy, but there was two other tables beside us. Three different wait staff passed us 7 different times and we were not acknowledged once. This was the first time we have ever been, and I was excited to try the filet medallions, but I don't see us ever returning due to the horrible (non) service we received.

onP7q2f2RxP5r88bS6eRnw.text: Ok, I may be a little biased, but I love Montanas. I've always sat at the bar and after a year of coming here, I still love it. I love the food and the bartenders. Seems like alot of families from the area are regularly there and also seems like they have a nice bar crowd. I think overall the food is great and it's going to be a place we regularly eat at.

JEWdvlmMmwg1MelqiK8QOA.text: I have been here twice.  Both times they overcharged.  The menu says one price and I pay a different price.  Last time was on St. pattys day; the sign said one price and the check was $2 an entree above that on the receipt.  This morning my sons breakfast was $2 more then the menu.  I'm not concerned with the $6, I paid it...my mistake for just giving my card without reviewing the check first.  Just poor business practice.  Too bad since the food is actually pretty good.  Guess I'll just find another place.  I wonder how much this place rips people off for that don't check the bill, $2 isn't enough to send up a flag so I'm sure people just pay and never realize it.

Overall they move it pretty fast and I like it.  The potato skins are my favorite!!!

Umhi30wVxzPoygw2yyolcw.text: Although my previous review was a little mixed most likely due to down system, this visit has been wholly redeeming with something as simple as chicken wings and chicken fingers. Num.  Before you profess on how it's hard to get those type of finger foods wrong, let me stop you.  I'm a finger food fiend and not all chicken fingers were created equal. Montana nailed it perfectly.  The service was great and they remember when I said extra ranch to give me extra ranch. Each order came with steak fries that were also oh so good.  I love the feel and texture of steak fries and these tasted oven baked and not over salted.   Very very positive experience!

W6FKXwGwWqE-F5q9gHP-HQ.text: Can I give it a negative 50?  Wait staff completely unfriendly, never came to check on if the food was ok, which it wasn't.  I ordered a fillet medium and it wasn't burnt so bad all I tasted was charred meat so I spent 45 dollars on a side salad, tater tots, and 2 beers. It's the Kmart of steakhouses #DISGUSTING

_vw_kRs56-CKGCJK9ixMPA.text: Having lived Montana I think this place is mediocre . Filet mignon cut was not soft. Appetizer was ok, nothing special. Though they do have nice clean bar with typical drinks.

SLxeRlsHhBR0rRt39Hvm8w.text: We've been here quite a few times.  Tried the restaurant side and the bar side.  Great food, great gaming and great service.  Scott is a great bartender too.  He's always friendly and quick with service.  Grace is AMAZING and totally puts up with my nonsense...   :)
