S5xpsSkMc-o_COOLzSXqEw.text: We really like this place!  It's close to home, food is good and service always good.  Missing one little star because the bar door was open so smoke carried into the dining area.. not a fan of cig smoke while eating! Other than that.. give them a shot!

ScbQM42axvLUn_Ejjgtulw.text: This place is pretty good and makes a good steak.  I've only gotten to go a couple times and can't comment on the restaurant service but the food was ready when I arrived and the bar staff was friendly.  Only complaint tho would be some of the sides we got we're cold so a quick reheat was needed when we got home but the steaks were cooked perfectly and was solid overall.

h8bF2R6dWBXgF-dt98DyRA.text: This place is a hit or miss...  Example: The country chicken mac and cheese is a new item on the menu. The first time I ordered it, it was amazing. I large portion of chicken and mac and cheese was perfect so I decided to order a 2nd time. The 2nd time, whoa...only 2 bites of chicken and the mac and cheese was really greasy. Not sure if it varies from cook to cook or really what the deal is??? Wish I knew.

Cprxclhz7ePY8nQN_L4ydw.text: I don't know what happened.. either new kitchen staff or whatever but this is our 2nd time here and I'm not impressed. My cordon blue came Smothered with this mushroom sauce which tasted like straight fungus, the breading on my chicken was thick to point it was fried hard. Caesar salad had too much dressing. My husband porkchops were covered with  so much breading he couldn't find the bone in it, the cream spinach were like liquid green goo. Only thing good was the bread I had to request :( Sorry guys not ur finest

xUHz8kucsYrW8EeInSoSoA.text: First time here with my girl a few days ago.  Decided to hang out at the bar and also ordered calamari.  Bartender was very outgoing and pleasant!  Definitely will come back again.

2Y_OYRkvf4Z55UHLydSF_g.text: I'll start by noting that a big part of this relatively positive review is because of the excellent service by our waiter. Aside from that the food was nothing to write home about.  My friend and I came in around 7 craving burgers. We decided to split a pastrami patty melt and a BBQ bacon burger, one with fries and the other with onion rings for good measure.   I sampled the BBQ bacon burger first and was not excited in the least. I commented to my friend that it tasted just like a bacon western burger only four times the price. A few seconds later our server came by to check on us and commented about how much she likes the BBQ bacon burger because it tastes like a western bacon cheeseburger. Guess I was right! I didn't care for the BBQ said very much so I stuck with the pastrami patty melt, which was decent. The fries and onion rings were a lackluster way to round out our meal.  Service was excellent and friendly, but there wasn't much else to make me want to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Patty melt
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2gARuD8dzvbmwDSb34a4-w.text: Been there a few times over the last several years. Other than the lunch specials being cheap, I cannot really recommend this place. The food is below average. With so many other places to eat, not rushing to go back.

Ud82JgG7mf30xtvzvzlwXw.text: When we are on the way home to Pahrump we sometimes stop at the Montana Meat Company on Durango. The Calamari is delicious. We have had good steaks, Cooked the way we like them. The steamed veggies are always fantastic. Here's that dreaded BUT. On our way home yesterday afternoon 07/27/18 we stopped and off of the lunch menu I spotted pork chops. I inquired about the pork chops and was assured that they would be cooked to order. What I got were 2 consistency of cardboard pieces of meat. I know that the state mandated 165f for pork. The state is not eating them I am. To preclude this happening I would like to suggest thicker pork chop vice 2 thin ones. Boss, take a trip up to the outback and try their chops, I'll buy. I am a pork aficionado. Have even become more one since my 11 years in Kuwait. Pork is illegal there.

PIEPbsUWFYjNPSXvQx8-_A.text: I really wish this place would get their sh*t together, being that it's the closest restaurant to Mountain's Edge and offers food 24/7. Every time I'm here the service is always lousy. Called an order in tonight. Bartender on the line seemed very flustered on the line from the beginning. Didn't repeat my order back to me and got half of my order wrong including both mine and my boyfriend's sides, had cheese on my salad when I reiterated no cheese since I'm allergic. Given wrong salad dressing too. It's worth driving a few more blocks for a place that will get it right with friendlier service.

n_B-NcXRGgwj9Jh5hhxHxA.text: First time to this place and it was delicious. Got the two ribeyes specials and it was definitely filling and a lot of bang for the buck. The meat wasn't  extremely fatty and I felt like I got a great value. The service was also great and made sure that our drinks were filled and our guests that were with us were extremely satisfied. As I am a new local to this part of town and new to Vegas  I will be Coming here many times in the future.

p6l9uDGjoQmbCyoTvcoIEw.text: The food is surprisingly good!  We ordered quite a bit off the menu, wings tots, ribs, steak, and salad.  I do not recommend the ribs but everything else was pretty good.   The service on the other hand needs a lot of work. We waited for at least 5 mins for some one to even come around to seat us. Just us standing at the front looking around.   They seem to be under staff. Our waitress was not very personable nor attentive. We asked for a drink menu from the bar... there wasn't one apparently. They are revising it since no one ordered from it.  We asked about flavored margaritas...nope no flavor and no blender either... so on the rocks it was. We each ordered one. Minutes after the server walked away, we found an old drink menu online. I wanted to change my drink so my husband ran to the bar to catch the bartender.... and change my drink. The server came back and confronted us... like how dare we change the drink and order off an old drink menu.  Anyways, drinks were good. But waitress didn't come around often enough. My drink was gone for a good 15 mins before she came back around.   Overall food was good... maybe better luck next time with a better server.

guNQiuNmiNIkXqYa7Z_PdA.text: The wife and I went their, just to check it out.  We were hoping to find a pool table... but we were not disappointed one bit when we didn't find one.  I had a few drinks, the wife and I play a few bills in the machines.  while sitting their we were so convinced in the level of customer service, we decided to have a meal.  the food was Amazing and the price was even better, or bar tender was Cherlyn and our waiter was Sayit.  both of then did an amazing job.   this is what we got  2 appetizers; fried mozzarella sticks and fried zucchi   the meal   20oz steak  2 sides Cabernett mushrooms steamed veggies  And the price only came up the 46 and some change....  WHAAAAAAAT?     I KNOW RIGHT!    It was too good to be True  We will be back.

azTA3f5oGuaA-pP42bJ-yQ.text: We go here once or twice a week. (My husband and myself). We live close and love this place. My husband thinks the filets are better than Mastros and many other on the strip steak house. I happen to agree. All of the food is good but the meat is OMG fantastic! Meatballs, wings, burgers etc -all fabulous and the sides and bread too! The vibe is chill. Typical gaming bar but the exception is Grace the bartender. She is fantastic! She can truly run a bar all on her own. Sometimes she gets busy and I see customers get ridiculous. Hello people- she is one person! She's attentiv, remembers our order every time. She's adorable, put together, funny, and personable. She really goes way out of her way to be professional at her job. One of the best bartenders I've encountered in Vegas and I know a ton of them! She handles each person with care and knows how to handle rude people. I'm usually floored bu the way she handles things sometimes. Amazing! The other bartenders are awesome too. Great personalities. She treats the people she works with and runners with such respect and is never "too good" to do any job. Humble awesome chick! She makes me look forward to coming every week!

vkYMtnZH7AthHnL-zgwjDQ.text: Our server matthew told us about there two 12oz ribeye for 34$ thx matthew!!  Started with a side of soup or salad and served along side a warm sourdough loaf with honey butter nom nom  Added the shrimp cocktail, came with 7 shrimp and the cocktail sauce was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz ribeye brown rice and green beans
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail came with 7 tails

vBk3Qs7GY-VTcfA4yglONg.text: Always good service and GREAT food. Not many bars in town boast that their food is great. The food is here is gourmet. All of the complaints are based on on the fact that the guys working here are overwhelmed by business volumes. Otherwise, don't expect someone to attend to your need of a single straw because they take EXTREMTY good care of me and others(based on business levels). If you have a problem with their service, take your meticulous butt to a steakhouse because you obviously don't understand humanitarian capability.

UEgjka4sb9Bs-OYdKw1lGg.text: We did not realize Montana Meat Company served breakfast. Missed that somehow. Drove by today and stopped in. Kudos to service staff and chefs. Our order was filled to the T. I ordered steak medium rare which was cooked perfectly. My wife ordered pancakes with side of well done bacon and those were cooked to perfection. I recommend everyone try the breakfast at the Montana Meat Company.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs with breakfast potatoes and sour dough toast! Yum!

EgAnILUSitAPrPFGSvxDrQ.text: Great place for a casual lunch! They have lunch specials for as low as $6.95! Lunch specials include soups, salads, sandwiches, and wraps. I like the macadamia crusted chicken salad. The chicken was so juicy, the greens were fresh, and the portion was very generous. Quality of the food exceeds the price. Try this place out. It will not disappoint.

HYZcss10EKvRNb0bDXVIbw.text: Walked in to get food and drinks with parents and friends there was 6 of us we turned the tables like we always do when we dine there . The bartender immediately stopped us and said we had to sit In the dinning room. I asked if we would have service and he said yes. He ignored us for 10 minutes . I walked up to him in the bar to see if we could have service and he yelled " hey sweetheart " I have a full bar you can leave. Then he demanding us to leave. My father who is in his late 60's is a classy man and was disgusted with the way he treated women. Needless to say we have been coming for years and will never be back !!! What a joke. GM or owners fire your graveyard male bartender.

puIgTfX75iQd07iW0TIaRw.text: I came here for brunch and I will definitely be going back. Their prices are very reasonable and their food is really tasty.   We ordered a bbq burger and jalapeno burger in the 2 for 1 deal, both were yummy. We also ordered the chicken fried steak, which was cooked very well. Their steak fries and home fries are really yummy too. The bill was very affordable.

vyiGLX5n5MlzifYgnG0rMw.text: Me and my husband went to the Montana Meat Co. and had a nice dinner. Our waitress  and the hostess were super nice and very attentive. After finishing our dinner we decided to go to the bar for some drinks and gambling.  This is when we started to wonder if we were invisible. The place wasn't busy yet the bartender completely ignored us. We didn't even get a "be right with you". He walked past us numerous times and finally asked us if we wanted a drink as we were getting up to leave.  My husband cashed out and we went elsewhere to play.  Won't be back.

4oidfaduODsUEqHJQ60-OQ.text: Will be forever known in my book as Montana sh*thouse.  Upon entry my boyfriend and I stood uncomfortably for a few minutes waiting to be seated. Expecting a hostess to appear, we were then told rudely by the bartender who was free to tell us this the second we entered, but chose to let us stand there for 2 minutes, that we could seat ourselves.  We then waited around 15 minutes to place our order. I had the BBQ burger, my advice is go to carls and get the western bacon. My bf chose the peppercorn burger- big mistake! It came with a patty covered in what looked like mushroom soup, with the fries receiving the same treatment, no onion ring straws, or cheese which was on the menu. He had one bite before deciding it was unedible. We wouldve loved to replace the burger with another item except our waitress/ bartender didn't return to the table till I had all ready finished my meal.  Food was ok/unedible.  Atmosphere was stale/smokey.  Service was non existent.  Server said just enough words to get our order, was rude, and treated us as if our presence annoyed her. When someones entire dinner is untouched save for one bite, common sense says maybe something was wrong. Server said nothing and whisked the full plate away.  I've had horrible service in the past, and have never stiffed anyone. But as the saying goes, there's a first time for everything, and Montana meat co was my first.  And as for their endless fries, maybe if you went in the kitchen and cooked them yourself, we were never asked.  Rating is zero stars, but I had to choose at least one to save this review.

szrX48Di5MoBENl5Ml6RxA.text: Delicious burgers n chix wings however the lighting at nyttym is kinda dim. They need to brighten that up a little.

4P28pFpAR7KHWvwvKy2dqw.text: 24 hour place and going during normal business hours is silly. Menu is okay and place is much cheaper than standard Las Vegas menus, but you can get much better quality pretty much anywhere else in town.   Now, they have a late-night special from I believe 11 pm - 6am where a lot of good items are $5. They have a good hamburger, chicken fingers , and a few breakfast items. This is a tremendous value and well worth it.  There's always a few people at the bar at any hour. Not hungry, feel free to have a drink. They also have slot machines and if you gamble they give you a couple free drinks if they see you play, so that's always fun as well.

LFN0vhzUf8HFn9m7TeXsqA.text: To start off with I really like the owners of these places. They ran the Tillerman many years ago and left to get started with one of the oldies but goodies "shucks tavern". It always had great food a drinks.   Fast fwd to today. My wife and kids went in to try this place again because it's right neat our house. It was busy and in fact one of the owners was busing tables to keep up. The $34 special was terrific and plenty of food for two I might add although service was still lacking. We sat for 10 min waiting to order after we got our initial drinks. Too long.   I was very unhappy about the amount of smoke smell in the restaurant area too. Wow that needs to change.   I gave it 3 stars because the value of their food. The place smells bad and the service the last 3 times was mediocre at best but hey I will get over it for the convenience and quality of food.

S3bKXPG8YiaFonLO4OcaVA.text: Food was great, with chef specials and healthy menu choices. Tasted great. Beverage service was great with continuous refills. A few hiccups on order when food was delivered.  Unfortunately the menu was confusing in that in the meat section, which states "fresh vegetables" included, had a "signature" meal for which "fresh vegetables" meant sauteed mushrooms and onions, umm what is "fresh" about that and why does this one menu item in the middle differ?  When the manager named Scott come to table he explained they were fresh when sauteed. He ageed to bring brocolli, but immediately issued the statement "this time only." Sadly with that attitude and comment there won't be next time! He was the bartender too, so not sure of his skillset and whether it qualified him to be a manager dealing with customer service.  The menu is confusing so FIX IT! Don't take it out on the customer, get corporate to fix it.

z67czNQrlNwMDsWeF4j56Q.text: Ordered take out today and they messed everything up and didn't even offer to rectify it. This place used to be good, don't know what happened. Their foods good, but their service sucks.

ZIAalojLE9icBbIAa7wE7g.text: They have a great $5 breakfast special.  My first time eating, was when I booked a reservation for my 16 year old nephew's b-day.  We had a family of almost 20.  They were very accommodating.  We ordered from the kids menu, steak, seafood, etc.  Everything was great.  My main reason for choosing Montana Meat was that it was close to my home.  We try to go as often as we can, now.

owwo4htpbN3pDERI6fYMog.text: Whenever I am in Las Vegas with family and friends, we have a "Eat Breakfast at Montana Steak House" tradition.  For the low price of the breakfast (under 5 bucks for most items), you get a mound of delicious food.  The Bananas Foster pancakes are the BOMB!!! Most of the menu items are also delicious.  The service was excellent, I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who eats breakfast...

LovUsEGpW4TF5ZK9W70MKA.text: The service is friendly, prompt, and welcoming. I have been here more than a few times and it is the same result...food is consistently prepared. My wife and I love the ambiance and the price is even better...their two steak special is another plus to try them out. If you live in mountains edge, nevada trails, rhodes ranch and you haven't been here, its a must!

b3FCmmRzm_tRVVqs_GLpOw.text: I've only been here twice and for burgers so this review is limited.  Having said that, the burger special here is ridiculously cheap.  BOGO free!  For 10-11 bucks, you can have 2 huge burgers and endless fries.  You can also get sandwiches and wraps in place of the burger.  They grind their meat fresh and it has that backyard burger taste.  It's just a tad bit more than eating fast food but so much better in terms of quality.  I looked at the grave yard specials and you can get lamb chops for 5 bucks...are you kidding me?  They also have cheap breakfast specials and a steak/egg special I will try.  If the food were healthy, I would replace Montana with cooking b/c it is so dirt cheap.  They don't make money off me because I don't drink nor do I gamble but i hope others continue to b/c on the food side, this place isn't making much money.  I hope their burger special stays for good.

5gfAhqou06x-2TdX_cgY6Q.text: Our favorite local steakhouse. Went on Friday night to celebrate my husbands birthday. Adam the manager took great care of us and the food was great.

4CLCz_d-OsxMSugYHhtF-Q.text: The service at this place was unbelievably horrible. From the time we were greeted to having our orders taken it literally felt like joy and happiness were being sucked out of the room by Cherlyn. The fries are great, the burgers... ehh. From the first bite of their sliders my teenage girls said that the beef had a weird taste like one that would end up making them sick. My husband and I both tasted them and agreed that they had a weird taste. By the time we got the servers attention and explained how we felt. All she said was "okay, I'll see if I can take it off the bill" when she came back she took the two plates saying that she had to show them to her manager, which we thought was weird. We figured that maybe she would offer to fix it when she came back but instead when passing by us 10 minutes later casually stated  that the manager gave her the okay to take the the charges off the bill... really?? With still no attempt to rectify the situation by means of giving us an opportunity to order something different, the "server" over charged our card. When we asked why, she stated that it was for one of the condiments we requested, which normally I wouldn't mind paying for but considering that the condiment couldn't be utilized due to the 2 inedible dishes, we thought it was a little absurd and poor business practice. We will not be revisiting this joke of an establishment.

kDVWhTCkezMk1SFrnNdi6w.text: Had a steak dinner. The steak was delicious, juicy with every bite the way it should be. Decided to get dessert too. That crispy bannana ice cream thing was a great way to cap of that meal. Great meal for a reasonable price.

VZriChs0fyMa-plM5ZxxdQ.text: Great deals and prices.  Good food.  Open 24hrs.  Friendly service.

aBOLg1RFvpDeCAKdPO4Rfw.text: If there was an option to give this place negative stars, I would.  First of all, you walk in and even in the dining area wreaks of smoke.  So you push that aside thinking your steak will be good enough to bare the smell.  Nope, ordered a medium rare, still tough as nails.  I ordered ONE drink, the same exact drink I ordered at Tex Mex down the street, a smaller portion for literally double the price.  Tex Mex $5.00, this place $10.00 for a vodka and seven up in a smaller glass.  Then, I asked for a side of ranch, charged me for it.  This place is ridiculous.  What are you? Gorden Ramsy Steakhouse?  Get out of here, your food sucks so don't charge me extra for ranch to try and get the leather tasteless steak out of my mouth.

4EKrMWCxAKe8fJ52tGD8Cg.text: Friendly service but our rib eye steaks were were thin and tough.  The baked potato looked like it was abandoned and re-heated.  There will not be a next time.

64NU5RHQEYjYCRm7z2KfLg.text: 20 oz porterhouse was good. Great prices as well. Wanted to get away from the strip prices and this joint did the trick. Not fancy but good food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O88HzEmdAYhUM3OTNKbiZQ.text: The food and the service are great the prices are awesome the only downside is they play hard rock music too loud and that's a bit much to stomach for breakfast.  This would've been our go-to restaurant given we live so close but the volume and the choice of music keep us away.

h37hSmq2kbnrj0TJGkKJUw.text: Such a great place and so close to home.  Service was great. Dave the server was awesome.  Food (rib eyes), the 2 dinner special was a good deal and plenty of food. One complaint:  Their is a bar attached and cigarette smoke lingers in alot, kind of ruined the meal.  With said, if they just made a little bit of effort to put a glass door/wall at the bar entrance, this would be fantastic place....

1480Dn58LrireKE7oR4fBw.text: 2 (two) delicious rib-eye steak dinners special for $34.95 including soup or salad and baked potato, mashed potatoes or rice pilaf with the dinner as well as broccoli.  Iceberg salad with tomatoes and cheese.  Choice of dressing.  Delicious chocolate lava cake with vanilla bean ice cream and chocolate sauce (the dessert cost was in addition to the $34.95 steak dinner special for 2 as dessert was not included in the special) all for under $50 including tax (tip was extra).  Solid value for a delicious steak dinner for two off the Las Vegas strip.  Great service.  Warm and friendly atmosphere.  Clean restaurant.  You will see a lot of locals here (and locals know best).  Will definitely visit again after this first visit.  Outstanding!!

W22dWdByPXHXtI8qOO3alg.text: I like this place for two very good reasons: it's extremely close to my house (I could literally walk here...it'd take me a bit, but I could) and reasonable prices. Would I come as often if I didn't live as close? Most likely not, but since I have no plans on moving any time soon, this is my go-to spot for decent eats at decent prices. Not to mention the fact that I could eat here every hour of the day.  The steak is delicious. That's probably what you should eat when you come here; don't stray. I've also enjoyed their Bolognese Pasta (the noodles were overdone, but sometimes I love that delicious, mushy, homecooked feel to pasta), Jalapeno Burger, Southwestern Chicken Salad, and Grilled Salmon. I also enjoy steak fries and that's what they serve! I don't care for their Bread Pudding or Calamari (I used to, but it's kinda meh now) though.  The only downside for me is the cigarette smoke, but that's what you get when you're in a bar. It's not as bad in the dining area, but of course, they close that part during the later hours, so you eat at the bar. It's still better than the fast food options in the area.

c7trer7CpzgmBu-STyXp5A.text: Any chance I get to be on this side of town. I definitely stop by here. They have the best Mac n Cheese and steak dinnerd!! Hubby and I had date night here and spent less than $40. The deals they have are amazing and worth it. I specifically have to servers there, i enjoy the most ,Brittany and Cherlyn. Super sweet, patient and attentive to my family and I. Always satisfied!

zN5OndlPt6NMxHo7KiqEdg.text: Great for locals at a good price. Nice change from typical chain restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari mustache

tPEKA6sWsrtv6mJc8oe04w.text: Went here again yesterday for lunch. Ordered the Rocky Mountain burger - a fresh bun puled high with perfectly grilled beef as I ordered it, bbq sauce, bacon, cheese, onion rings and a side of their steak fries. It was delicious! The person I was with had the Regular burger Kobe style same as I have reviewed before. Once again a hit! Fresh lettuce tomato red onion mushrooms bacon cheese with a nice perfect patty and bun. The same fries.   The real kicker was - we had only ordered one drink at the time (I only wanted water) and the waitress notified us that if we have one more drink the burgers are BUY ONE GET ONE FREE! So of course I ordered a coffee and we were set! We both ate for around 20 dollars including tip! Saved over 10 dollars!   Either way the burgers are worth the price. All their food I have had is. I will continue to go back :) but this burger deal makes it another hit in my books... Totally worth it! After all - who doesn't love great food and good deals?   :-) try it! You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky Mountain BBQ Burger with steak fries. Delicious!

Uv97cHwtffXjdBOKTL3vuQ.text: As others have stated, this is the place to go to for some great bar food. And the Graveyard Menu?! Even better! I'm always tempted to over order just because of how cheap and good everything is!  The Range (chicken fried steak) is amazing for the price that you're paying (six bucks I believe) and the shrimp cocktail is surprisingly tasty as well. I'm always ordering to pick up and every time I'm there- It seems as if other people are doing that too.  Customer service can be on the slower and spotty side but it's understandable when there's only one person running the game after midnight. The only thing they could change is how bright it is inside. Other than that, I'll be back. Especially when it's close to home.

FVN5weag0fqykIR-LQJmsA.text: We've driven past this place many times and finally decided to stop. Disappointment! I'm not sure who writes a review for this place and says the service was amazing because it was far from the case!   The server was rude and unfriendly! She would say something like 'oh I'll go check on your food' and then go to a table with her friends at it and chat for 5+ minutes... Thanks for checking? She would tell us she was getting more napkins and then wouldn't come back for close to 10 minutes. Horrible service not a single smile or tiny bit of personality in this girl!   On to the disappointment of food. She asked me how I like it cooked and I said pink in the center. She said that's medium so that is what I ordered. My steak, while tender and semi-juicy, was very dark and brown. Not medium. The fries were soggy and flavorless. The steak tasted like beef jerky. Way too much artificial flavoring and way too much Worcestershire sauce!    The other food we ordered was mediocre and pretty blah. I will not be coming back here. Nothing positive to write about.

hSLP18Mg9sMmUQQUopAEYQ.text: Eating an excellent Top Sirloin! Friendly and attentive server! Definitely will be a return trip in the future!

hsmaXkz6K-om0NOXNi6q2A.text: Great food and the staff is a lot of fun to be around!! Noticed a ton of pick up orders.

Scmt7xgXRWfz0vgMkw4hdQ.text: Love Montana Meat Co.,  I always wondered what this place was like since I pass by it almost every day.   One day, I finally had a chance to try Montana.  The vibe in here is cozy, the booths and chairs are comfortable to sit on.  The lighting in here is a little dark but I like it.  A great place to get some burgers, fries, steaks, and beers.  A friend showed me this place and he said that all day and every day they do a BOGO on their burgers, you order two burgers and get one free.  It is not advertised, but if you know about it mention it to a staff member.    I tried the sliders with onion rings, I finished everything on my plate!  It was delicious.  Definitely had me coming back here for take out!

i1ZizIKkqO0NEUHnyrPthA.text: My girls were hungry after the movies tonight so we decided to give Montana Meat Company a try. This experience was doomed from the start. Let me say before I get into the details that when I get a Millenial server, I always hold my breath and pray for the best. We were seated by a girl who looked to be in high school and did not greet us or even smile when we walked in. She was on her cell phone behind the podium that she was standing behind, so my impression is that we were keeping her from the latest Facebook post or possibly a snap chat that just came in. She led us to the table and then backtracked around us to get back to her important cell phone business that we distracted her from.       We weren't greeted (because that would have required an introduction and a smile), but rather approached by our server Cherlyn. The only reason I know her name is that I looked on the receipt when the bill came. She took my girlfriends drink order and asked my 3 year old what she wanted to drink. When she came back with the drinks they were in very large plastic cups. As she was sitting the drinks down the lightbulb came on in her head and she asked if we wanted a kids cup for my daughter. Well of course, the cup is bigger than my kid was my response. We finally got the right cup and we began to order. We got the chicken fingers for our daughter from the kids menu and we asked what options she had for sides. Steak Fries was her response. What about a veggie I asked? It's whatever they have she said. Ok, I'm getting annoyed now. I finally got an answer that consisted of some mixed information. It's either green beans or Broccoli for a green vegetable, but it depends on what they have was the response. I explained that my daughter doesn't eat green beans so if you don't have broccoli then bring some fruit instead. Cherlyn seemed a little annoyed by this request and immediately began to take our order. I ordered the 10 oz Filet medium with a baked potato and my girlfriend got a burger and steak fries.       A food runner brought my daughters food out first and right on cue it came out with green beans. We explained that we ordered either broccoli or fruit, so we scraped the green beans off and he brought back some fruit. A minute later Cherlyn walked by and asked how the food was so far. We began to tell her the mistake, but I don't think she heard us because she never fully stopped and began waiting on the booth behind us.       My steak came a few minutes later and I knew I was in trouble. The Filet was a thick cut and I had ordered it medium. When I cut into it, the inside was very rare and mostly cold. What a shame. I payed market price ($30.00) for a cold piece of meat. The server should have offered to butterfly cut the filet when I ordered it medium. Any decent server at a steak house knows about the meats that they serve and if the Filet is cut thick it is very hard to cook it medium or well without burning it, which is why I opt for the butterfly cut in those situations. Another surprise was in store for me when I found green beans on my plate. I had no idea a vegetable was offered for my dinner, or I would have chose something else. Amanda's burger was ok, and we payed the bill and got out of there.        This was a miserable experience and we won't be back to get burned again. What a shame, because this steakhouse is in our neighborhood and we really wanted it to be good.

szumrJ0Ore9oB1MJyBdfwg.text: Idk what's up with some of the bad reviews of this place. Seriously the late night staff is so great and between you and me I always win $$$ here! I recommend the Big Sky Burger- after 11pm it's only like $7 with fries. Love this 24 hours joint- best burger since I've had since moving to Vegas. Also a huge plus is that it doesn't smell like an ashtray. As a non-smoker I get fed up with bars that make my hair and clothes smell. I can't speak for day time but after 7pm I've never had a bad time here!

1Bz74tF4GsFwpxLlNhfv1A.text: Ok, we have been here twice and I have mixed reviews. I really feel like the food & service could be better. When you pull in the smell is INTOXICATING! We have had pasta, nachos, burgers, mozzarella stix, etc and they have all been... satisfactory. I haven't had anything noteworthy. Maybe I need to try the steak?? It is close to home, but honestly, I pass it up regularly when thinking of nearby places to grub.

YEVwWdg7KEAMOG4LPEV52g.text: Cherlin is the best waitress!!!  She is always pleasant and extremely professional which is the reason I always want to return!  Love this restaurant

AvAH4MFuRTbtYTsS-RRE8w.text: We enjoy their burgers! It's always fun to come in to see Wes. He is the best, always fun and friendly. He goes over and beyond to take care of his guests.

5nQlrC3IB_61MJXXQyKLlg.text: Had a very good meal here once and then another night the food was nothing like the quality it was the week prior... don't order the club sandwich.

KMa_8ITbLTF6QsJcNkWAiw.text: I love the new menu!!!!  Super excited to see they have changed the menu up and also added some new seafood items. As a non meat eater I would sometimes get bored with the menu but can always modify things to get them without meat so I'm a fan. I love that they have added fresh oysters on the half shell, crab cakes, steamed clams/mussels, and more!!!!  Their sister store, Shucks, always has great seafood so I wasn't hesitant to try it here. I actually enjoyed the oysters & linguini and clams so much last night I came back tonight to watch MNF and try some of the new items. My server/bartender, Scott, recommended the crab cakes tonight and I added a baked potato and side Cesar salad to accompany it and it turned out to be a perfect meal!  They also now have Ballast Point Sculpin on tap which is a bonus. All in all I love the new changes they have made. They were saying that they just celebrated their 10 year anniversary at this location.  Clearly the owners have been listening to their customers because the new machines, updated menu, and professionally dressed staff is a nice update to Montana Meat Co. I'll be back again more often.

delZW2Q18J812cE1JDbMhw.text: This is probably the last time eating here, not as good as it used to be! Took my son and we were both disappointed in most the food!

tblfnbFwW7riS6q9rg9Lgw.text: First time in, was a dope experience. My fiance & I find extreme comfort in bartenders that don't try to engage in extensive conversation. Dave, the bartender homie, was polite & made sure we were taken care of. Excellent service! Wasn't the biggest fan of the ribs, whatevs, we're gonna come back & try something different.  More bars need tenders like Dave

-SLdnWSdAEymbD1qiUZ3uQ.text: Gross swampy cigarette smelling dank bar area serving up all the people who enjoy that sort of thing. I order a pick up order two separate times, each ordering something different. The food was decent, don't expect anything fancy or special, just decent. I would keep ordering for pick up, however there is no reason I would stay and eat there. This place would be better without the stank of a swanky old bar.

GLzTbmE09GyVGekgDgrxFw.text: The waitress was rude! Refused to serve us. The place smells like an ash tray. We were the only people at the restaurant and it took 20 minuets to get our order

-9v6ieokQwWYiGL_TJ-UIg.text: I've only been here once for the bar and for their food for the very first time last night. Although, it is only a couple blocks away from our home.   My family and I decided to indulge so we went ahead and ordered rib eye's, T bone steak with lobsters and spinach artichoke dip for our appetizers.  Everything was absolutely palatable. Our steaks were cooked perfectly the way we want it. The rib eyes came with baked potato and string beans; never mind the sides just focus on the main dish! (I'm not really big on baked potato and string beans) our meal also came with salads.  I'm so glad that we came to this place after coming to find out that our favorite sushi spot closes early on Sunday's.   Montana Meat Co. is open 24/7 their prices are reasonable for the food you receive and they are generous on their portions.

GhKxwM0RQrMzT3Hipl8ydQ.text: Went on Sunday 3-13-16 at about 7:30 PM for dinner.  This restaurant is located on Blue Diamond and Durango.  The ambiance is casual and it does have a bar inside but it's separated from the dining area so kiddos are welcome, although we didn't get a high chair or booster seat.  Imagine a 24-hour Applebee's.    $87.28 got us a t-bone steak dinner, a filet dinner, a kids quesadilla, a side caesar salad, two soft drinks, and a lobster tail.    Both our dinners were supposed to come with bread and butter but neither ever came.  I didn't bother to ask about it.    Our server was nice enough but disappeared for long stretches and had an inappropriate amount of cleavage showing.  I am no prude, but if I can see your sternum you need to cover up a bit.    She did let me order first for my boy which I thought was very thoughtful and understanding of the impatient nature of toddlers.  His kid's quesadilla disappeared quickly and I snagged a few of his crispy steak fries and they were delicious.    The caesar salad was fair.  The romaine lettuce was crisp, and it had just the right amount of tasty dressing, croutons, and parmesan cheese.  It was a pretty big portion for $3.00 but the lettuce seemed to be the bagged variety or perhaps chopped a few days in advance because the edges of each piece were browning.    $28.95 T-bone steak was cooked well and came with a baked potato and broccoli.  Husband said the flavor was good and boy, was it big!  The $23.95 filet dinner came with the same two sides and was thick, juicy, and perfectly cooked.  I found myself wanting a bit of A-1 but, alas, our well-endowed server was not to be found.  The broccoli was bizarre because each of us got maybe 4-5 florets but they had huge stalks still attached.  Pretty cheap veg if you ask me.    $15.95 lobster tail was the star of the show. It was huge, cooked perfectly, well seasoned, and so sweet.  Probably one of the best lobster tails I've ever had.  It came with drawn butter and three lemons and I coulda probably ate three more.    Food was passable but for almost a hundred bucks after tip I won't be back due to the long distance from my house.  You can get better food elsewhere, cheaper, and faster.  Their most popular item is two steak dinners for under $40 and I would definitely stick with that because they come with sides and salad or soup for that price and that would be a deal.

MWxeqy8zu15SQFprSU7qmA.text: Cool neighborhood bar, bartender and staff are super friendly. The Mac and cheese served at nite (3am) was the best. I think it had a mild buffalo sauce in it. I'll be returning

hlt6EpZ7YSEaKR7VNhfpng.text: Great steak, good variety of sides, and friendly service. The only reason I'd give it four stars, and not five, was because of the quality of the wine. We were not offered a wine list, unusual for a classy place like this. I thought the house wine was kind of ok (a little stale,) my friend did not finish his.

4y77RZ0SeCLVwL78-c1JcA.text: I made a visit to this location about a month ago and it was absolutely a delight!  We had some really great service by the bar. I wish I remember the bartenders name, but he was so funny and very helpful with us exploring the menu.  I remember settling for a martini I saw on the promotion menu at the edge of the table. It was a really good, get-the-job-done drink! Just what I was looking for at that time! I ordered a French Dip that was packed with delicious roast beef!   This spot is hidden on Durango right before Blue Diamond, but you'll more than likely be able to smell the place as you're driving in.   Make sure to go with good company, in case the food takes a bit longer than expected. They're just putting extra love and effort into making it perfect!

RIX4PZvo5dtaDNpFzNsmPQ.text: My wife and I really like Montana Meat Company and come here often.  Food is always good and portions are large.  The Chicken Mac and Cheese on the "Specials" Menu is amazing.  My wife always gets it.    The burgers are really solid.  I'm a bit of a burger snob, so they're not the best I've had by any means, but they're definitely good!  Especially the Peppercorn Burger and the Rocky Mtn burger.  Overall, the food is good, very reasonably priced and the staff is always friendly.  The only reason I don't give 5 stars is that it's more of a "nice bar with better than average food" than a "Steakhouse or Meat Company" that you might think based on the name of the restaurant.    I'm from Montana and I was expecting to have at least a Bison steak or Buffalo burger on the menu.  If they wanted to be really True to the name, there should be some elk or venison somewhere.  Maybe it's harder to have wild game on a restaurant menu in Las Vegas than I'm imagining, but either way, whenever we go there, I always have a tinge of regret that there aren't actually any "Montana Meat's".

HW5bQGufwK2TiI2Z0R1XTQ.text: I'm not sure if the kitchen staff changed but I've been living in the area for 6 years. In the beginning this place was great, went back about a year ago and you can definitely tell that something has changed. I thought it was just a off day but Nope. Went 2 more times after that and I was not satisfied at all. Kinda breaks my heart. I used to love this place.

UCidOM9PPkYBTtbqMm9mrw.text: It has been a few years since we have been here but we wanted to give it a try again.  I have to say we were VERY disappointed.  We ordered an appetizer of fried zucchini and all it was was a mouth full of oil.  We ordered our dinner which was the rib eye special.  Absolutely no taste and nothing but fat.  Baked potato was so hard extra butter didnt even help.  When the waitress asked if everything was ok I said "for what I can chew its ok". She asked if I wanted another and I said no. Ended up sending giving my plate back and she just took it.   Not even an apology that I left with out eating. We only left a tip because it was a courtesy and growing up in the industry we knew it's the right thing.  We will NOT be returning. Oh and we didn't even get bread with our meal.  NOT happy.

zwhJZMfL2BlbRvQAb6M69w.text: I like their pricing meal specials. Good variety on menu items. Food does not have a lot of flavor though.

qB7TTrCS11WmAnZi2med_A.text: To start. The web site posts their phone number which happens to be the number for Shucks not Montana Meat Co. Last night four of us went to Montana Meat for the Rib Eye special. The salad was really good. The steaks were very tough. Hard to cut and very chewy. Not what we expected. Very dissapointed. The restroom was out of toilet paper. Will give 2nd thoughts before returning.

YeyGwSoUDEhqUdEhu_L8lg.text: Great prices, good food, casual & comfortable always. Reasonable prices - GREAT Burgers & good Breakfasts. Our regular go to restaurant for a quick meal anytime of day.  Thanks.  Ron & Oksana

Q4K1Tu2BVQlMj_W3bYkVzQ.text: I love Montana's for two very solid reasons.    1)  It's literally walking distance from my house. 2)  Their breakfast menu.  No, really, it's bomb.  It's cheap, delish and more importantly, they wrap it up well for carry out.  It has and will always be my go-to spot for Sunday breakfast.  At least until brunch finally becomes cool in Vegas.  Now just because it's cheap doesn't mean jack.  The old saying "you get what you pay for" doesn't apply here.  It's a damn bargain.    Side Note:   Owner, just because I said it's cheap doesn't mean you need to go around raising prices.  Ya heard?  Us Yelpers do have the option to go back and edit our reviews.  :-)

SakJeIo7DhAQ-nH8XVaD5Q.text: For a good hearty meal, this is the place to go too. I loved the lamb and mint jelly, to die for. I never tried any salad or seafood type of dishes. The service was great.

pVZLwFIl2Ppv5gKv7jB1pw.text: Gross, cold and just plain nasty. My wife and invent there and we really had high hopes. However they were soon turned to disappointment. Our food came out bland and cold. The steak was like rubber and the steak fries were terrible. Like I stated we really wanted to enjoy this place.   The staff was nice and polite.

jX5Z7Vv4EWKQHD2MLd4TSw.text: We usually come in here to get food to go at the bar. Tonight we came in to actually sit at the bar and service was horrible. Bartender serves the frequent customers first with priority and by the time she got back to us I was a little irritated by then. Understand she is pregnant but if you cannot keep up with the clientele then you need a less busy shift. Have had other bartenders and waitresses that were pregnant and no issues, they helped all equal. Wife enjoys the chicken fingers so will definitely be coming back but will not sit at the bar or in the dining area!

1Dk-22IflOk_b3Yc5vnVIA.text: This is our go to, "I don't want to cook tonight" spot!  Fist of all, kids meals are very low in price so for a mom of two little ones, that's a HUGE perk! My husband and I typically get the peppercorn and the big sky burgers. With a buy one get one deal it is totally worth it. My favorite burger place in Vegas, and lucky for me we are close enough to walk if we wanted!  When not in the mood for a burger, I may do the Alfredo or possibly just a sandwich. The medallions are another favorite of mine!  The kids get Mac n cheese and chicken fingers to split. I have to say, I can't help but munch on those fingers. They are the perfect amount of crisp without having dried up chicken. Breakfast is our other meal that we frequent for. Bananas Fosters pancakes.... YUM!!!!  I'm not the biggest fan of the breakfast burrito, but everything else I've tried has been spot on!  For a quick meal around the corner, I'm so thankful we have Montana!!!!

Wnoi9mjC4RTiVHLLEIRmJw.text: Brought the GF here for dinner one night and thought we could get lucky and find a new steakhouse.   Started off with the Bacon wrapped Scallops. I have never had a Bacon wrapped Scallop that has impressed me, and that hasn't changed. These Scallops were overcooked and sitting in liquid.  The Mango Salsa was unappetizing.  The Lobster Bisque was very good. I like that it was en Croute with a dollop of Creme Fraiche. That one was a winner.  The Steak was pretty good as it should be seeing as they are a Steak house. Done to the right temperature, flavorful, and topped with a nice herb butter.

_SW8BVCLJjQdG00jFRO0xA.text: Great late night menu and happy hour here is also great! Usually averagely busy in the bar section, never sat in the restaurant side. Cool place to hang out. Great atmosphere. Not bad for bar food.. We've even picked up food to go a few times.

vR9Bwek4DZgYoKwylE0JFg.text: This is a solid 4 star steakhouse.  They don't exactly boast stunning decor, and they aren't exactly the lifestyles of the rich and famous destination, but what they lack in presentation they make up for in value.  My server was quite polite, and we were seated quickly.  Food was hot.  Prices are out of this world.  My wife and I ate a multi-course steak meal with drinks for less than 50 bucks. Stellar deal.

XTjz3ULJMDS0v2n1DeK4rQ.text: Montana Meat Co. is greaaat bar food!  I came by for some late night eats with friends and the place did not disappoint. They actually have a pretty big menu and really pride themselves on their cuts of meats. I guess the place could fall under the steakhouse category because it has a large selection of cuts but we stuck to the breakfast/late night menu.  The breakfast menu is big and cheap! So many skillet/combination plates that you can pretty much find whatever you want. The prices are pretty good - $6 - $8 for everything on their late night menu. They had pretty good specials on drinks when we went - $3 for all draft beer and $4 well drinks - can't really hate on that.

GqmVddPlKph3cOyyJtEHlQ.text: Did I ever mention I love this place so much????? ----- maybe NOT because I couldn't find my reviews here.  However, Yes, I do.  I do love MMC 100% for sure ( I mean their lunch special )!  What I still remember is that they provide LUNCH SPECIAL for ALL burgers, salads, sandwiches and wraps $5.95 $5.95 $5.95.  What I still remember is that I usually order: 1. Filet mignon salads 2. Turkey wrap 3. Chicken caesar wrap  Also my co-workers always have: 1. Walnut chicken salads 2. French dip 3. Burger --- sorry! I'm not a really real burger fan, so I couldn't remember their names, but you can ask for it :)  One one one thing I need to mention: PLEASE DO NOT GO DURING 12:00-1:00PM because it's going to wait at least half hour for just order your food. Their service is kind of slow.   Oops! Do I say their slow?  Yes, they are.....  but Filet mignon salads without onion is my best dish. I'm here just for it.... worth it!   P.S.: you will meet many of G4s during lunch hour  :)

WCP1wiy743DNNkZ1Ch1I_g.text: The food here is great. The staff here is friendly. I love how they have bogo steaks and bogo burgers. They also offer takeout which is convient. It is nearby my house and my family always have a pleasant experience here.

Ia5hiKKtYXYa52_XiA3Hfg.text: The bartender Wes took great care of us during our late lunch today. The food was beautiful & delicious. I WILL be back!

fC5iBtLfjBMgTFtaqOsKBA.text: I used to come here all the time, and it was awesome. Then they changed bartenders... Here's what happened.  Came in with a few friends around 3AM on a Friday night. We were all a little tipsy but wanted to stay close to home so we made this our choice of bar. The bartender took about 15 minutes to come over, my friend actually had to shout out "excuse me" to get his attention. Normally i would make an excuse for a bartender not noticing someone sit at the bar, but he had to literally buzz us in since it was after midnight.   When we ordered our drinks he then went over to the group he was chatting up prior to us "interrupting" him. 15 minutes later he brings us over our beers. No reason this should have taken so long. But we were gaming so my other two friends didn't really notice.  It then took us several attempts at getting another round. when we finally succeeded we decided we would go somewhere else. We had gamed a total of 280$ between the 3 of us and each had 2 drinks. We asked for our bill and when we received it we noticed not a single drink was comped. I'm not one for complaining when i don't received something comped but that is ridiculous. We paid our bill and still left a 10$ tip. My friend also asked the bartender for a pack of cigarettes but we noticed it wasn't on the bill so we figured he just didn't charge her. When we were leaving we walked out the door and out comes the shouting bartender. "Excuse me!!! You guys didn't pay for those cigarettes." My friends laughed, threw him a 20$ and we left.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of one is because I hope to return to this bar and see another bartender. But until then... this will be my review.

913-qi9QZKOb_k3txOlJHQ.text: Late nite burger and ice cold beer!  This a nice place for breakfast, lunch, dinner or a late night snack as that is when i am typically here. Good service, cold beer and gaming!

qg4j1rCZcM0sVjgSfbNu3w.text: This was a great experience the food was great and service was superb. We spent the whole evening there even after our food was done 3 people kept refilling our cokes and checking on us even though we had paid the bill. Top recommendations for this place.

rAxLOnnkBo8q1MvQDyjuWg.text: I like this place its right by my house me and my husband go there for good drinks and they have theeee best bacon wrapped shrimp

8-xjBvfllE1yvVbIRCMGqw.text: We came here for the first time tonight and sat in the bar. The service was fast and friendly. Our food (Peppercorn Burger and Mac and Cheese) was delicious and came out quickly. The place is clean and not smoky. Our beers were cold and never left empty. Great spot for comfort food. We will definitely return.

oXN5R25RoCmYBAkjBppCJw.text: Great lunch special, very good, steak sandwich the best

ye6x-Vc-PZz3xEjuIcSfFA.text: horrible place to play, and get the drink. bar tender, grace, will charge you to the roof even if you play. we have been going to this bar for the last 6 years but never again. and beware of this bartender grace. she is going to charge your drink.

p6aJu3zRSP90EFhfC-a5yQ.text: Not impressed by any means. Had a friend in town from LA and I just moved to the neighborhood so I thought we would give it a shot. Our waitress was a complete ditz. We waited 10 minutes just to have our drink orders taken. By the way, there was maybe 3 other tables seated...not busy at all.   We order our drinks, I ask for coffee and she says "oh I don't have any fresh" and so I replied with, "can you make some?" And she says " oh ok, but it may take a while".  How dare I ask for coffee!!! Little did I know she would be referring to the entire night. My friend orders a rock star and vodka and when she finally brings it, it's just the rock star and says "oh I thought you were kidding".   At this point I knew we should have left but he was exhausted after the drive in, so 30 min in, we get to put our order. He orders the rib eye and I order steak medallions.   About 50 min later, I, in that time had to stop two other waitresses for refills on drinks and also asked if our order was put in. She sends over my waitress and she says "I'm so sorry we had a large group come in AFTER you so our kitchen is backed up"   I can't believe this. Finally an hour and 40 min after arriving there, our food comes out. His is great, mine? Cold. Cold steak, the "grilled" onions were raw and cold, and the mashed potatoes were cold with luke warm gravy. It takes me another 10 min to flag down a different waitress, by this time, my friend is done with his meal, I ask to speak to the waitress and I tell her how terrible the night has been. She apologized and asked if I wanted soup instead!! Then proceeds to hand us a bill for $70 for a food plate that I didn't touch!   First and last time. I now tell everyone about that situation and I would never step a foot back in there. The food would have been better at Sizzlers! And for the service? How embarrassing for you.   Disgusted.

5121UeD0ZwGEsImYn1kf7g.text: Fun, friendly atmosphere with delicious food! Go have breakfast for $5.95, or try their $6.95 lunch specials including salads, sandwiches and wraps from 11am to 2pm!

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz ribeye with mashed potatoes
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macadamia halibut
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki bowl with chicken

mEEFMUIabyO5YExkepMM_A.text: Just had their burger, one of the best!  Second time there, Steaks are great too.  For me, it's as good of food as anywhere on the strip, but with out the hassle of actually going to the strip to eat.

QkHD8IJdMBAOEs5JLMgIEQ.text: Came in at 6am on a Sunday morning, and really felt the love even though where is the love was playing by the black eyed peas. Reece is a great bartender

DmFOE4XShxuIPk_dBE1C0Q.text: I have ate at a lot of nice steakhouses in Las Vegas and I have to say the calamari here is the best that I have ever ate.  Their salads are so fresh with the best homemade ranch dressing.  I have ordered the prime rib and cowboy rib eye and both have been excellent.  The homemade bread is so yummy that I can make a meal off of it alone.  The staff are so sweet and constantly checking on you.  You will not be waiting on anything because there are always enough waiters around helping out. We asked to see the manager which happened to be one of the owners and he was very sweet and told us how long all his waiters have been with him which was 4 yrs to 12 yrs. I can't wait to go back and try a few more items!!! :)

kUQ6uhaUYuSiX_0Q5jnHJA.text: I like this place. Low key, comfortable atmosphere, decent quality steak and fast service, no complaints,

EBAzXLQ--PyYZ-9gNEie8Q.text: My family and I stopped in for the first time in December. The food was good. What I liked was our children could come with us. My husband and I ordered the steak special and we were not disappointed.

uhWM0-ml2jf7ds7GY9Xe_A.text: Called to place a take out order and was placed on hold for 7 mins.  Not even a 'sorry for the wait after a minute or two....no thanks.

-bHqC3ZVktDNJ5zLZlo9mw.text: My roommate and I got hungry at night.  Seems to be very common now.. We look for graveyard specials.  He's been coming here several times, first time for me of course. This place is like a hidden gem for me.  I wouldn't have notice it by the name of course.  From the outside, I would have guessed they cut meat inside.    We parked it at the bar area, ordered 3 burgers with soda.  That burger came out and dang! Not bad at all.  Very decent sized and cooked as how I asked for.. Medium rare.  I stacked up the lettuce, tomatoes, and all.  First bite, very flavorful.  Not too salty on the patty.  Steak style fries? Nice.  I ended up clearing up that place quite fast.  Bartender kept my soda cup filled of course.    Their graveyard menu is limited, but I don't mind.  Makes me pick faster and usually a small menu is good.  Place is spacious and has plenty of tv's.  Music is constantly playing with lots of video poker screens around the bar.  Seems like they get lots of regulars that come in.    Overall, I would come back.. Only if my roommate drives me of course.  Place is quite out of the way for us.  You hear that? Drive me!

JgAZorX97SFYVEmAbkUSdg.text: some of the best food in the southwest!! $6.95 lunch specials daily from 11am to 4pm and a ribeye dinner for 2 people for $34.95, what an amazing deal!!

BxugoZlc13ELZ6UZJksahg.text: We have frequented Montana Meat Company typically on the weekends - late night, early morning and love it.  The service from the bartender is spot on, the food is incredible - no matter what you get - the Kobe Sliders, the Eggs Benedict, Steak and eggs - it is all wonderful.  The prices are good and it is a fun, safe place to be.  We can't wait to go back!

s6lkWmrUkW7adNU21p-qaQ.text: We eat at all times of the day. Regardless, the food is always on par and exactly what I'm expecting. Dinning in or taking the food to go you will not be disappointed. Highly recommend this place.

AxvgL0Q6_JAYmagTGjI7yw.text: They have an amazing ribeye special and delicious desserts. They've changed their menu up a bit and have some great new selections. The staff is always friendly and provides excellent service!!

_Z9ZJBuYCOmAkPJ8FrYP0w.text: Have been eating at Montana for the last few years. Tonight we went and I had the country Mac and cheese. I live 1 mile from here. By the time we got home I was deathly ill. Sweating, severe abdominal cramps, vomiting and the list goes on. Never have I been this sick. My fiance and I also had the spinach dip for an appetizer and he didn't get sick so we know it wasn't that. I called and asked to speak to a manager to inform them because I didn't want other people getting sick. Her response: "I'm sorry, I'll let the kitchen know".  There is no way I will ever come back.

UjZSGMogAS8QpTDHaz8jag.text: Had a wonderful Hawaiian breakfast of loco moco ,  prepared with ahi.  This fine dish was suggested by Wes,  who was a terrific bartender and server.  Marvelous time,  fantastic brunch and the ahi was perfect. . THANK YOU WES!!

yhr83DA8vyWvbTLy9umfNQ.text: I used to like this place a few years ago but I've been disappointed lately. I had the Filet medallions and what I got was two pulverized well done slices of beef swimming in a VERY strong wine, mushroom gravy. There was so much of it on my plate that even the asparagus was soaking in it. I don't know why they chopped up the asparagus it had some butter sauce on it and the whole dish was very heavy. I ordered a baked potato and it was HUGE but there was nothing on the inside of it like it had been scraped out and they filled it with semi-fried onions. It was the strangest meal I've ever had there. The bloody Mary I had was very good and the waitress was pleasant. Shame I paid so much for a really disappointing dinner.

IifsUpsQhD07kCNrYJscDA.text: So new to the south west and wanted to try to places around this side of town  Took my brother to Montana Meat Company as it is close to home and it had good reviews   Well the food was average for a pub style eatery.  The steak special was nicely priced for what we got     Food seemed freshly prepared and the meat was cooked to order. The potatoes were a bit undercooked for my liking.   The bread was probably the best part of the meal, hot and fresh.    The service in the other hand was below average for what I would if excepted from the reviews   Slow service of the staff, it was a bit unorganized between the server, hostess and the food runner.   Will visit one more time to see if it was a service fluke

Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye special

-toXgNJaZvDUqGi8sCxn2A.text: NEVER EVER GO! Horrible service and the manager is aggressive and confrontational. Wrote the wrong bill for me and I asked him politely that it was wrong and he said too bad. I said seriously? And he chased me to parking lot saying he wanted to kick my ass? All I said was he charged me for an extra drink and he said he was right!! My gosh

LoZTjhiPPzuxNbzLOazX1w.text: The food was very good. It came out to the table quickly. Oliver was a wonderful waiter who kept our drinks full and we really appreciated his service. Thank you Oliver.

nW92ApD9NXd75ZezumhNHg.text: Typical bar food.  My friends wanted steak and we didn't want to drive to the strip.  Decided to check out MMC.  I ordered medium rare and when our stakes came, mine was rock hard, by time I was able to cut in the middle there was no red or even pink so my friend shared half his steak with me.  The fruit on the side was mostly cantaloupe.  The balsamic is sour, don't order it with your salad.  The steak and the rest of the food taste like the free steak or the cheap steaks you'll find at the old casinos on Fremont.  The restaurant was absolutely freezing, even the men at my table agreed.  There was a family who brought their lap dog and staff didn't care....I love dogs but they do not belong in restaurants on laps or maybe have a warning outside the door.  I'm only giving this place 2 stars because the chicken wings were delicious but expensive for the small amount you get.  They were the only thing that tastes like it was freshly made. If you want overpriced bar food, this is your place.  Next time we will just drive to the strip or even outback could taste better. Ha.  We won't be going back.  My friends are foodies, many other options in town.

C1J5kZn_vCf54MMyrLVLMg.text: This location has a Manager Scott who I spoke to about my food being over cooked and he apologized. So his response was the next time I come in or call to place a order that he would do something for me. So I just called in another order now even though he's not in he left a note in his offer. Stating that my next order would be comped. Now that's what I call good customer service and standing by your word even in your absence. Thank you very much Scott.

LSe4HU0EY2022Bg6wSjGmA.text: After passing by this place for a dozen years, finally, and it was worth it. Great bar area and bartender, courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. My meal of a flatiron steak was excellent, along with the sides. Restaurant area is set up nicely with different sitting areas. Will definitely be back, in fewer then 12 years!!!!

OEk46i9qqZxiZAf0wQEKWw.text: Second visit and it wasn't as good as the first. I came here about 4 months ago, for a business meeting. I had a pleasant experience here with friends. The food was decent ( not excellent) and the service was good. It had a comfy atmosphere so I decided to come back again with my son and husband for an impromptu dinner date.   This time around my experience was much different. Obviously the atmosphere didn't change and the customer service was still decent but the food was below par. My original visit I had the Pork Verde. It was flavorful and the portion size was great. This time around I had the pot roast which was a huge mistake. It was slimy and the portion size was tiny. The sides looked like they literally came from a van with no seasoning. I was highly dissatisfied and saddened by the experience.  My husband ordered his go to nachos. Again... the hips were under the salamander too long and were burnt. The cheese dried up and was gross. We won't return.

2oHGfl0xV29IBRLZADTQkg.text: Restaurant was clean and we were seated immediately. Service was good. Server was attentive and made sure my coffee was always filled. Pancakes were tasty, but slightly undercooked in the middle.  Huevos Rancheros we're not really traditional, but still very tasty!  I would prefer the Mexican, queso blanco instead of the yellow cheese in the sauce was a little on the spicy side, but still very tasty and I would order it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

suBhKnfa1xodGIn22tyqVg.text: Pretty good graveyard menu. I dig the Crusty Italian wings HARD, honestly gives me life. Wings are discounted past 11 PM. Would recommend!!

f883o73MBa6t1wDUqVRIMg.text: This is the second time I've had a horrendous experience at this restaurant. I wish there was a way to give them 0 stars, but there's sadly no way of doing that. Here's tonight's experience:  The poor girl behind the bar has no help, so you can't receive prompt service. I experienced this before, so I called ahead with my order, but still had to wait 10 minutes while my steak got cold. Not the first time this has happened. I ordered a rib eye, but received what I believe is a sirloin instead, though it could have been anything else for all I care, it was terrible. It was burnt on the outside and flavorless. I called to let them know. Then instead of just replacing, she decided to tell me that this poor excuse for a steak was fine. So I said never mind, I don't want it. So now that I'm walking out of the restaurant she asks whether I want a refund. I told her to forget it, I just didn't want to deal with them any longer. I hope they have a cute dog they don't love too much to give it to.   Never go there! Even the convenience of having them close to home isn't worth the waste of time, the poor service, the burnt steak and the annoyance.   Update: 3/10/2019  After a year and a half, hunger, lack of time to go elsewhere, and convenience have brought me here again. I've upgraded the review to 3 stars from 1. My server, Destiny, was prompt, personable and unobtrusive; she did a fine job. The food was vastly better than my last experience. If I blasted them for the previous awful experiences, it was only fair that I praise them for the current positive one. "The bad doesn't wash out the good" nor the good, the bad. But it does average it out. Good job today.

v_bu9mrFSOLkA55j8AywUw.text: Montana ribeye w/ vegetables & mushrooms. Yum. It's always good!! The desserts are also great.

jq8PouT2zjcN4JPRoYpu6g.text: One of the times I was at Montana Meat,  I seated myself as I usually do,  as I am waiting for service, a girl ask have I been waiting long? Almost 10 min I explain,  well you didn't wait to be seated,  EXCUSE ME?    Apparently the Filipina   girl that was talking to me was the one that was to seat me but wasn't anywhere to be found cause she was in the bar watch something on TV , also there is no sign that states that I am to wait to be SEATED! besides all that negative service, The food is great as always and that what keeps me going back.

H2YQFFqLbQ7LXGDwKid7ew.text: Being from Montana, this is the best slice of home away from home! The service is always great and the food is just as good. The meat is very good quality, and always cooked to perfection.

OPC7PG0tunFvA-z9Vx2DOA.text: Hey local gamblers!   Here's a friendly heads up we all know we're losers 90% of the time ..right? It's the risk and fun that we find attractive ...and of course the  sub-par well drinks or/ cheap wine Right??....on the extremely rare occasions that I've been a winner, it has  always gone back into the machines, always...whether it's 20 40 or $100... I've never felt it worth it or fair to just walk away with an extra 20 in my pocket and a few free drinks...BUT  I sure wish I would have done that last night !!###...after starting with my normal 20 or $40 I reinvested my winnings as usual.. and over the course of 2 hours had my wine glass filled and/or topped off several times..usually without being asked because that's always been the norm here... only to find out at the end of the night I had accrued a $100 bar tab!!... adding insult to injury I then got accused of not putting enough money in to warrant the free crappie wine glass top offs ....if this is how 10 years (and literally 1000's of $$$....)of loyalty is treated/rewarded I would definitely take your hard earned money elsewhere...  As a courtesy to your future victims-Brian-...management (like every other gambling establishment in town) SHOULD be putting drink tabs in the glass in front of us ... so we both understand the running total !#!#...rather than bending us over and ...."blindsiding" us.

bh1FNCfeXKmLE-yKSfaMmw.text: This place is under rated if you never tried their Grilled Lamb Chops with Honey Basil sauce then your missing out had Ribeye that I end up taking home since I already had Lamb Chops and couple round of Heineken Light beer. My Server was very polite good job. Good early dinner.

MhqEAKFgieHJCSzHPFD2Kg.text: Good service, good food, clean table. We ordered the French dip with onion rings and the peppercorn burger. Next time, I'm going to ask for the bread to be toasted.

lQPX0jQc5hxb2Diz6u08iA.text: My hubby and I've had a dozen salads each for late lunches the past several weeks.  We are ALWAYS impressed with the variety, freshness, and awesome flavors...our favorite is the Walnut Chicken Salad.  The service has always been great no matter which staff members are on duty.  We truly enjoy this place and are planning some evening dinners with friends.  We like to introduce great friends to great dining experiences!

qFyX5l2cbMsODbpN3Kethg.text: I usually come for the Prime Rib which they have limited quantity of. I always ask before going if they have it available. SOOO GOOD. Oh and the lava cake.. yes yes yes. Get it. I have had the filet, salads, shrimp cocktail, pot-roast and multiple cocktails. Sometimes the food is hit or miss. Had a baked potato hard as a rock one time and another time perfect. They do have a separate bar area that you can gamble and get drinks. When you walk in it smells like smoke, but doesn't really travel to the restaurant area.
