KvDrktwxFPxlTaivBWyxyQ.text: Pretty standard Nevada pub. Nothing really struck me as note worthy. Bartender was attentive. Guiness on tap was good. I suppose I would go again if I wanted to mix it up. The cash advance cards they have by the slots kinda tacky

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-zpAs25lMNQj3S52hqPB4A.text: The service was not good. My daughter asked for a refill 3 times and never got it. The fries were cold. The waiter has a bad attitude. This was my first and last visit. We were invited by friends so I had no idea what I was in for. Staff wasn't friendly at all.

omRYpjaC8obEOECPQwYhfw.text: I come here a lot with my family when we're craving American food.  They have great deals and amazing food.  Their portions are huge and the food is always great. They have a rib eye special for two that was less than $40. I can't remember exactly how much it was but definitely a great deal. It came with hefty sides and the meat was cooked perfectly. Their breakfast food was good too. Everything on the breakfast menu was less than $5. I got the chicken fried steak last time and had to take the rest home for lunch because it was a huge serving.  The atmosphere is nice. The restaurant portion of the building is nice and quiet, separated from the bar. The lighting is a little dark but perfect for a steakhouse. I haven't had any of their drinks yet but I heard they have good deals. I'll have to check it out next time.   The service is hit or miss. There were times I got quick, amazing service but there were other times I couldn't even find a server. It seemed like they only had one person there to attend to the entire dining area of the restaurant at times. I don't mind waiting a little so it wasn't a big deal. Aside from the wait, the people there are really friendly. I don't think there was ever a time I got a bad vibe from anyone there.

8viAJIseOCES0VW3jo9lyA.text: This place is close to the house so we go there a few times a month. Prices are good. Food can really range from ok to good. Would like to see them take it up a notch though. Guessing a lot of the food is frozen or pre packaged. The servers are really hit or miss. A few are good but one or two are bad. I honestly hate going somewhere and the server is slow or non existent but you can see her just inside the kitchen area playing on her phone for 15 minutes without looking up.

W2Tz05wSKTgZrMTYsOvzYw.text: For basic bar food this place got creative. Lol the only thing that is good on the menu in my opinion is the filet stacks. If they take that off the menu I may not eat here again. lol the cheese raviolis are okay also. Otherwise it is just a basic smokey bar.... Decently priced.

yzgnXlW_YSwrB685QWjJDA.text: How can I put into words how much I adore Montana Meat Company?!  Lucky for me, I literally live five minutes down  the street!  Never had a bad meal here, regardless of what I order. The breakfast menu cannot be beat for the price and the late night menu is awesome as well.   Super friendly staff, good food specials, this place is great.

hUMQUZn2O8vHkaGGu2zG6w.text: Only because my Grandma wanted to eat here did I go. Who argues with Grandma? My salmon was dry, as was the baked potato (even after heaps of buttery goodness). The booth we were given in the dining area was in desperate need of repair- ripped and lacking padding. But who doesn't like to eat in a hole?   Service was attentive, even somewhat friendly.  I wouldn't come back to eat, as there are better options, but maybe check out the lively bar one night.

yYDXvJHuw6_H_GsCvwA4ow.text: Fast and efficient service. Great graveyard specials,  lunch specials and drinks too. Friendly staff and management. Ask for Emily the bartender during the day she is awesome

MtXfZH-PTa-_Ku5zim6qGg.text: Nice and quiet during the late afternoon.  Ordered the ribeye and was cooked as requested. Mash potatoes came with a really good gravy.  Also had the french dip with onion rings. The au jus was a bit salty for my taste but had good flavor. The onion rings were crispy and made with sweet onions, will definitely be having them again.

YZZZqZjdFWjiH-mQOMjRwQ.text: This place is great. There are seldom sketchy people, the food is phenomenal late at night (I can't say it's all that impressive during day time). George in the kitchen makes the best tasting food---I've never been let down there. The grave yard bartenders are attentive, talkative, and humorous. This is a go to spot by Mountain's Edge. Oh, also their selection of steaks and burgers are phenomenal.

Tb1slXLT95jj68syDoOMxw.text: Here for Breakfast...I ordered the Steak and Eggs...The Steak was cold...The eggs were cooked the way I like them...Over Easy...The Potatoes were good...The service was good...I sent the food back and asked to take it off the bill...And don't return the food...I'm Done...Won't ever eat here again...

iIuU7jIFD3qcl0rE0sqaJg.text: Went to dinner last night after my girl wanted steak. We were seated right away, which is crazy on a Friday night in Vegas. Our server was really good. No waiting to order or refills on our drinks. The food was really good. The Diablo burger was great and she got the 10oz filet which was outstanding. Instead of an appetizer, we decided to get the country chicken mac and cheese. Our server asked if we were sharing and we told her, "yes." To our surprise, they served it in two bowls instead of one without us asking. Montana is a hidden gem. My girl left her to go box on the table. One of the staff ran out to the parking lot to give it to her. I highly recommend this place. Great food, great service, excellent staff.

thPCSuWJ0xFgNlb2qHtjFA.text: The food here is good and location is great. I suggest the bogo burger deal. We come here often and is a great place for friends and family to get together.

l4pUqPDlTrz1mtC2k55WqA.text: Visited on 7/25/16 around 7:45pm and sat at bar. This place typically isn't my first choice but besides fast food there isn't a whole lot around and didn't feel like driving down Blue Diamond. Went in with low expectations as I didn't get the best service my last visit about a year ago. Was very smoking inside which was not friendly to my asthma. Servers name was Cherlyn (sp?) and I was helped right away. We ordered a 10oz and 7oz filet as well as calamari and drinks. The calamari lacked flavor and was very skimpy especially for the price. The filets were much better. The server helped us with all our questions and concerns and seemed to be running the show herself and I felt bad about keeping her so busy. Long story short... A better visit this time but due to the outstanding service rather than food. The smoke needs to be handled and options other than steak need to be reevaluated.

G8xntf9GZ9HuUcfxha4OHA.text: First eating here Reese the bartender was really cool I loved the food Had steak and eggs I definitely will come back

EAmmM6_lElCRUGFZTWEhkw.text: Service was great  The food was not good, over cooked steaks cold appetizers  had to send everything back at least once Manager showed no concern. ruined my family dinner.

ACi8JcgrsQ5BHrfHr1FAiw.text: Unbelievably great!!! Went here for an impromptu dinner with the family, since we live right up the street, so close by and we passed it often. As soon as we pulled up in front, the smell of fresh cut steak hits you and your hunger anticipation increases!  We had the 2 ribeye special that came with all fresh accompaniments...salad, hot bread, baked potato, and fresh cut string beans.  The steaks were cooked to perfection, service is awesome, and food is beyond great! Also, the tap Stella beer was super freezing cold for the hot Vegas eves.  This place is underrated and it will now be our local go to.  The prices were very reasonable as well.

43OT5lpu6HvDAxLMH64vZQ.text: The sever was nice  but the food was like a cafeteria that's all to be said good bread

juDbG0dGY3aOV98IXIHxuA.text: The food is usually good (which is why it's 2 stars and not 1) but this is the second time I come where I play the machines for over an hour,  have 1 drink and they don't comp it. Seriously?  1 cider and I lost my gambling money and you don't comp?  Not coming here any more. .

LcUn5mlV04WpEWta45stWw.text: I'm a sucker for a great steak and was so unimpressed with this place. I am giving them 2 stars because the waitress we had was so nice!  Call me spoiled but my expectations were high considering the name of this place. Hugggge let down. I ordered the Steal Medallions for $22 and I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. The French onion soup trumped the steak in food department. They should call this place "French Onion Soup Co."

A1UUQeSnMG2LTTqO1ZdT4A.text: We still have yet to figure out how a few restaurant/sports bar owners on this planet do not realize that it takes very little to please a customer. We lived in the meth- head capital of the world previously and could still walk to a super fun sports bar with outstanding food and customer service, and not pay much money, but were happy to return regularly. We got to the Durango Montana Meat place at around 5:15pm on a Friday. There were stragglers in the bar and only a few booths of diners were filled. We were greeted and our server stopped by to see if we would be ready to order. Lackadaisical at best. You know the drill- end of shift, out of personality, Sorry folks. We were struck by her indifference. We ordered and received our meals which were a steak sandwich and some fish and chips. Onion rings were flown out from Hampton Beach NH 1968 and heated up, it seemed. My husband had students who were fresher when he was a teacher. Steak was tender but those oversalted canned mushrooms in gravy were disdainful to the customer. Fries are ok but they obviously sat on the kitchen counter while Unbusy Server waltzed around trying to look productive. Fish was fair. I had really thought this place would be alive and worthwhile. I rarely leave a place so daunted. We gauged that the quality of dessert may not be high either and left to go to Art Square and First Friday where there may be a hot sweet snack to soothe our despondency. WTH Montana Meat? One of my stars is for the Worcestershire on the table and one is for the sports we can watch here. My husband found the right word for the current state of affairs here: the food was pedestrian. Usually I can find something even in a humble cafe and it's called customer care. None to be found here, sad to say.

buNmnGda8GyULrZTVFbgVQ.text: The food, service, and music were on the same frequency as I was.  As a gambler and a fan of oldies, plus some bomb steak, I was surprised how well my visit went.  The steak here was better than the five dollar ones at some locations.  Better than the fancier deal breaking steaks at $14.  For $8.95 I felt it was cooked like a medium rare.  Which doesn't happen often where I thought the steak came out the way I wanted.  Mark on graveyard was a great bartender.  One of my favorites.  Come down!  The graveyard crowd is a steady and welcome flow.  Graveyard here is great.

LeyTCJx6IHdURKzWljbXPg.text: This place is amazing! easily go there twice a month if not more.  If you go in the evening, ask to sit in Mark's section.  Might be the best waiter I have ever had.  The food is outstanding - Mark's service is beyond good, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality of food you get.  I have had maybe 12 different entrees on the menu and have not been disappointed with a single one.  Highly recommend!

0IcI-LTkpWyUdxp_E1m4NQ.text: 2 for 2! Dinner on 11/24@1030pm, they close at 11pm. And if was fantastic!!   Kitchen was slow so restuarant side was closed but the bartender said it was ok to order food from the bar but my niece was under age so the bartender let us set on the restuarant side. Yay!!  Food: excellent, I had shrimp alfrado and side order steak. It's $4 for 4 small pieces but I still love the flavor and how tender the meat is.  Service: excellent considering she was managing the bar and had only one helper I would surely come back and bring family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best I ever tasted.

YD1oakRqQ9KJaZgVQWEpjA.text: I am kicking myself today for driving by this place twice a day and not stopping in. Coming in we were quickly greeted by the hostesses. The dining room was far larger than I was anticipating. Our waitress Kristy, was very friendly and took our order very fast. Even though it was fairly busy, you could still have a nice conversation inside.   The burgers we ordered came out and I noticed the buns looks like they were baked in house. The meat was seasoned well and cooked beautifully. Nice and juicy. The fries were lackluster, but were definitely edible. I had the poblano burger. It was flavorful, but not hot. Delicious!  With the burgers being this good, I'm looking forward to coming back and trying the ribeye!

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poblano Burger

pXE0RyJZQHc-vvuWTMpfXw.text: This is a local gem. The food is pretty good and for such amazing prices! I've ate here twice and both experiences were great. I think my first time, I had french toast. It was a pretty standard french toast, but what impressed me on how cheap it was (I could just be jaded by bay area pricing tho). The second time, I ate here with my family. There was about 10 of us, and they were able to seat us right away. The server was also really attentive to us as well. I appreciate how quick service was and how affordable this place can be for large groups. Portions here are also really big too. Highly recommend eating here for brunch :)

ZNsh7EiqjemQug2ZkKm9RA.text: This place is the best!! Bartenders are awesome and the food is great. Always come here for my Stella on tap and chef salad which is sooo good.

Io2bDiaNHJ_hqXp4PizJ9Q.text: Went to Montana Meat Company with my family and was excited to try somewhere new.  the place had been busy, the tables had not been bussed right away and set up. Our hostess ended up wiping off a table and allowing us to sit down. The busser's  were busy.   Our waiter came over we ordered. Food came out fairly quick & was hot and as we ordered it!  Never saw the waiter for a long time after the order was placed, wait staff delivered food to the table.  We finally got a refill on our drinks almost at end of the meal. i know the place was busy but a little service would have been nice. Not impressed. Probably wont come back! Service does matter! The food was good, but service sucked!

atobBX3DxAlCIhWv8VcKyA.text: It is our first time dining in this restaurant and I was very disappointed with the service and my meal. I ordered the fish & chips. The fries were good but the fish had no taste. My husband had the steak which he liked. The best part of the experience for me was the complimentary bread. That taste the best. The server was very casual & took his sweet time coming back to us for ordering & giving us our check. My baby had the Mac and cheese which was ok. I was going to order dessert but was so turned off from the service & food. There are so many restaurants that compete with each other. So customer service & food quality is key to maintaining loyal customers. If customers feel important & welcome they will return.

aOuABVFhGyXML1GVSst_tg.text: Was very disappointed when we went.  Moved into the neighborhood and was so exciting see a place so close we could go for hopefully a nice dinner without driving downtown!!  and my family lives in MT so I know what to expect from good beef!  My husbands steak was awful, Fatty and over cooked.  I ordered fish ( i know should have ordered steak) and you could tell it was frozen/thawed, watery, terrible.    But seeing the reviews might give it another chance... parking lot is always full, a good sign (?)

WGbfmiSSEc0j7VPZbIByIQ.text: Food is great and they have great prices but the ventilation system is horrible. It always smells like cigarette smoke.

DExSv0r0jg3HlfqOK1F1Tw.text: This may be one of the worse Rib Eyes I ever had. We ordered the Montana Rib Eye and we literally couldn't even chew it because it had so much fat that it wasn't even chewable. Also the veggies are clearly just frozen veggies and they are super soggy. Seriously the most depressing meal I had. I had to go to McDonalds across the street cuz my food was so bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Montana Rib Eye

IKlD2rfpv_Srvzl-vka_rQ.text: I really am surprised by the recent, good reviews. I'm not a Yelp conspiracy person but how do they have so many good reviews up front?   We were seated in the bar right away. The server was bad. He didn't ask us what we wanted, just said "hi" and stared at us. Pretty much the way he was the rest of our stay. He looked like he didn't want to be there. Me either. The alcoholic drinks were horrible so I settled for a Cabernet, figured they couldn't mess that up. Chips and salsa were good. The fish and chips could have been good but they were cooked in old grease. They need to change the oil out.  You can tell by the burnt look and the taste. Phili cheesesteak was the "worst" my boyfriend .ever had. When the waiter took our food, he could see I barely touched mine and declined a box. All signs point to, I hated this food. But he didn't ask (he didn't care), he just took my food. Literally, the worst way to spend $52 we have ever experienced. We wondered if we were being too harsh, I mean can everything be bad? Yes. Except the chips and and salsa.   EDIT: I specifically indicated "recent" reviews as the ones that pop up o

KU_tXn1jzbCi6V2vMrCpng.text: What can I say about this place; the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, the food was delicious, and it was a great environment to eat and have some drinks. Ordered a decent list of food; calamari, wings (10 pc), and the New Mile High burger. The calamari was delicious, it came with two different sauces (marinera and a chipotle sauce). Ordered the 10 pc wings and the waitress let us try two flavors (sweet sriracha and chipotle BBQ). The wings were cooked to perfection and were definitely jumbo size. Now on to the burger, I ordered it medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. The meat was juicy and the burger was full of flavor. The secret "mile high" sauce they include is delicious and I highly recommend you use it to dip the burger. They mention it's a full one pound patty, but it's two half pound patties, but either way, it's a huge burger so if you order it, make sure you come hungry. Highly recommended as it was good until the last bite!

Y9Ii0nsu17K207lm9Lgg2Q.text: If You are looking for a great place to have a nice meal this is your place I have been coming here almost every Saturday morning and let me tell you there service it's amazing.I Love the attention of each employee that works here, But I Love to be help by Gaby she is the best always with a smile, super sweet and helpful

dOGgnkV3xCxWbQ_2jsx0Vg.text: This place has a calm and pleasant atmosphere during the afternoon, and the meals are served quickly. The staff are friendly too.   I ordered the mile high burger medium rare, it was pretty much rare, but that's okay because it was still good. Could use a more seasoning as could the fries, also with more fried onions, but overall I really enjoyed the burger. Though next time, I would like to order something different. Something with more saturated flavors.  My boyfriend order the Chicken Alfredo pasta, creamy and delightful, with a side of bread that is off the chain.   We are happy with our experience and do plan to return; maybe order something new too.  Thanks!

You could normally sit down for a while and have some fun while you play the machines. I've tried many food items here from breakfast and dinner. You've got to try the beef dip! This is a great sandwich, served hot with au jus. They have quality food for a local's bar. There are many TV's playing various sporting events if that's your thing. eC5SuZwpZVM3JC6ofV8I3g.text: While in town on training and staying with a friend of the family, I was introduced to this nice restaurant.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, very steakhouse type of feel. I ordered the strawberry salad with chicken and raspberry ice tea. Our server was extremely attentive and witty, her personality was evident in her sly comments. Very sharp lady! My salad was huge and very fresh, chicken was very tender and the special dressing on the salad was scrumptious. I was so full, I couldn't finish my big bowl of salad and felt bad for leaving some behind. A definite recommendation to anyone looking for a good steakhouse while in town, on the south west outskirts of Metro.

3fKbc-yzKPJV9P7EfpOHbw.text: This place is cute and wasn't busy. They have a pretty good menu. A little bit of everything. But I probably wouldn't eat here again. My friend comes here with her other friend and they enjoy it so don't take my word for it. Plus side: got seated quickly, bread was good and well the toilet paper in the bathroom is nice and high so you don't gotta pull a muscle trying to get toilet paper   I ordered the Greasy Spoon and asked for it well done with crispy bacon. Bacon was fatty and soggy. And the cheese was like 3/4 inch of soggy Velvetta tasting cheese. I took a few bites and stuck to my steak fries. Service was decent the waiter left our salad and app plates along with 2 bread boards on the table so it got pretty crowded and after a few trips back and him not taking them we finally asked if he could clear them.  Worth a try, maybe you'll like it.

We love the bread they serve while we're waiting for our orders that sometimes we enjoy the bread more than our own appetizers. The staff is very friendly. w8VR_A00WqjnLNcrTiDTJw.text: I've been to this location quite a few times and have always received consistently great service and tasty food no matter what time of day we've stopped in whether it be breakfast, lunch or dinner. My bf and I have never met a menu item we didn't like.   Most recently we had the country Mac n cheese and the tuna salad. I was pretty po'd when the bf wanted to come here instead of having the sushi I was so badly craving. I mean, the tuna salad sure wasn't the sushi roll I was craving, but it was pretty yummy and satisfied me at the moment.   Looking through the reviews I'm pretty surprised to see negative comments on the waitress, Cherlyn. We have been served by her a few times and she's always been pleasant and attentive. Even when my boyfriend was adamant about no onions in his food and it came out with it anyway, she kindly took it back and had it fixed with no onions. My boyfriend always knows how to ruin a meal by fussing with the ingredients.   I'll be back here time and time again in the future I'm sure. Great local spot for some good grub.

lZZ-DIyFjrhkh2kALUOoPA.text: Love this place ! Come here about 5 nights /mornings a week! West is so friendly and attentive. Good music , great food , and drinks. This is my go to bar to bar a quick bite to eat or after a Long night.

EBakUNUfcYOoo_EjBAeuDg.text: I've been coming to this place now for a few months because it is open 24/7 and is right down the street from my house.  I also order take out at this place at least once a week if not more and have noticed some things that have finally made me choose not to come back to this place anymore.  First of I would like to say that the prices at this place are great, very hard to beat, quality of the food is okay to good.  Some items are a great deal at a great price, that is what kept me coming back to this place.    Now since i've been ordering take out for the past few months I've realized that they ALWAYS mess up on something in the order.  For this whole time it's been something very small (no onion rings instead of regular fries, missing bacon in a burger, no guacamole, etc.  Now this has more often then not but in my head was not such a big deal that it would change my opinions about this place. Also during my experience here I've never been charged a "togo charge', this past order their was a "togo charge" and when I asked why that was there and that i've never been charged that before he arrogantly said "we always charge togo charge" bs. buddy, this was my first time. Okay that's no big deal though, let's get on to it.  Just recently my girlfriend ordered a salad for take out.  When she came back home to eat it there was just the salad, no dressing.  This was obviously something that needed to be brought to their attention so we called them and had to drive all the way back so that they could give us salad dressing.  Once the second trip to this place just for one order was done, we get home again and crack open the salad.  Once the salad is "tossed' with the dressing we just got, we realize that the salad was iceberg lettuce when it clearly says on the menu that it is a mixed green salad.  Also it was supposed to have other items in it as well (blue and red tortilla chips etc) and those were not present either.  They basically made it completely wrong and tried to pass it off to us. This is absolutely unacceptable and i'm not willing to pay for something i don't want.  We placed another phone call to the restaurant this time to talk to a manager since all the other employees seem to have the heads up their asses and I wanted a resolution to fix a "simple salad' that they somehow miraculously ruined.  The manager that answered the phone was Bryan, he seemed nice on the phone and when explained the situation he said it was okay and to come by either tomorrow or the next day to get a refund.    Upon going to Montana to pick up my refund we were met by another manager Scott, this guy was not on the same page as the first manager and was actually extremely rude and completely unprofessional.  Upon giving us the refund he had the nerve to say, "How I do business is to have the customer bring back the togo order to fix it" (which we already did) ,"and he also threw in that it is the customer's responsibility to make sure that their order is correct when they pick up their order. "Excuse me? Don't you manage a restaurant? That's not how it works, you don't say a customer is wrong, fuck you man, just getting fired up thinking about this ass and how he is somehow a manager.  Oh and by the way when he came to give us the refund, he threw it on the table and walked away!!  How mature, as long as this guy is working there, they will never have my business again.  Scott if you're reading this, get a new job, this one's not for you. Get a job where you don't have to deal with people because you've got bad attitude and shouldn't be dealing with customers.

RhfcUzRFQeDimf9tmfovaQ.text: 1 star because you have to Atleast give a star. Worst food ever. Might as well go eat at Denny's.

f1KH_6KFB8x7B-lAsFK50A.text: We always come here for breakfast. The food is good and the price is always right. We have also had the Kobe sky burgers for lunch. That is a very delicious burger. Again, can't beat the price.

JjFt-5YT3KEtsuRIG2GsZQ.text: Comparable to pt's, the food is good and all the servers /bartenders are friendly. I usually get the wings or breakfast. The "but burner" sauce for wings isn't that hot, but I find myself craving it because it's so good. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they don't ever comp my drinks when I gamble, pt's always does so it's kind of annoying when I lose $50 to a machine and still have to fork over cash for a beer.

0T2h_ASkE381BBu23RIFWg.text: Montana Meat Co is a fantastic find.  They're right around the corner from me and I've been here several times at each meal of the day.  GREAT food at good prices and good service.  It's hard to find a good steak dinner for less than $30 anymore let alone dinner entrees for under $20.  Breakfast, lunch, dinner or just drinks in the bar-  you NEED to try this place.

sn-npbR0-guExwQl1Ba7mA.text: Grace is a terrible bar tender..... Unless your a gamer.... She will cater to you if you gamble enough.... But regulars and locals that dont will be ignored.... Our sever and us had to wave her down for service. If your a gamer come in,  if not don't bother on her shift.

ay_7GexR3ZFvq10c4_42vA.text: My family and I used to eat at Montana's once a week, and it had been awhile since we ate here (we moved to the other side of town). So we decided to take the drive Sunday night for dinner. Unfortunately, we came on an off night. Our order was wrong, my husbands pastrami burger was VERY dry. AND the lemon in my iced tea was molded. Don't think we'll be back anytime soon...

o7TnKUD-g1S_2sX-gM6h8w.text: Steak flat iron and grilled shrimp afternoon  special very reasonable came with fresh sauteed green beans and Baked Potato with whipped butter sour cream and diced scallions.  Very pleasant friendly staff with big smiles. I shall return. The menu is extented and my hostest bartender waitress Wendy was a absolute treasure.

BiZy6fDfFhXSMPjAyXAieg.text: Been here 3 times.  I always get the special 2 steaks and vegetable and potato and (soup or salad) for like 39.99 or something like that  They cook my Med rare steak perfectly.  Of the 3 times the service and cleanliness has fluctuated:  1) Table in the bar area. Service Great, Clean table. 2) Table in the restaurant area Good service, Clean table 3) Table in the restaurant area Mediocre service and a very Dirty table(soda, balled up napkins, sauce and straw-papers and a lemon wedge hiding behind the salt shaker).  Over all good. Grab a friend and get the 2 steak special. So close to 5 stars if it was onlt cleaner and consistant good service.

XFVljNrnVK1K3Oy3DJambw.text: Great breakfast.  Sadly their steaks aren't great.  T-bone was tough,  rib eye just didn't taste right, and I'm pretty sure the asparagus came out of a can.  It was diced and mushy.

XZOsRx5nPWjQH93bkKPrwg.text: Super happy to see that they now have  potato skins! I had some today! They were nice and crispy and had a good amount of cheese on them!

HUgRLXt8w16fPLmRmfGmNg.text: Been going there for about year and a half since i live down the road. The Kobe burgers are great and the beer selection is good. The setup is comfortable and not too crowed. The service is good except for one day but i think one waitress for the dining area was having a bad day. i don't eat streaks enough to comment on but the selection is good. i just like the fish, burgers and beer.

FFKBX9aHB-_NDy1c4aTlag.text: A decent place for steaks in the southwest of Las Vegas. Service is nice but the quality of the food has been hit and miss on in the few times I've been there. The Cajun style rib eye steak, Cajun fillet pasta and bacon wrapped scallops were excellent on this last visit. Desserts are huge and good for sharing a Chocolate Cake and NY style Cheesecake was enough for the 6 of us. Nice relaxed atmosphere.

T0Y6b5PRpMORqdTQpN1TJA.text: Let's start with the service. We were seated, given a menu then asked if we were ready to order. Um, no. We never heard about the specials, I had to get up from the table and look myself. After we ordered everything came out lightning fast. App, salad and entree so quick I thought they wanted us gone. The appetizer was spinach/artichoke dip. Mayonnaise with some spinach and artichoke put in then heated. Horrible! The salad was just a salad. Nothing to write about. I had the macadamia crusted  halibut. It was nothing special. My husband ordered a steak medium rare, it came out almost raw. Our son had sliders. They were so dry I'm guessing they were cooked earlier and then reheated. The overall experience was completely disappointing. If it was reasonably priced I might not have even bothered to post a review and just never went back. But for $68 dollars, even for 3 people, I expect a little more. We will never go back.

vkKhmy2WDApn51HolAOPYg.text: My fiance and I were craving a steak and had Poynted a steak place on my smart phone.  This place came up 4-5 stars so we decided to try it out.  When we first walked in it took a good 5 minutes to get greeted...but as soon as our "soon to be busser" saw we were waiting, he came up to us...greeted us, and seated us right away.  We had automatically realized that the restaurant was short staffed...we work in the hospitality industry...so for that fact, we were very understanding. The appetizer, the blackened tuna, served rare, was delicious..and the price was shockingly reasonable for a 6 oz. piece of tuna.   After that we had a 10oz. filet, split, that was ordered med rare.  It had come out rare to our disappointment and we had asked to put it back on the grill for another minute or two to get it up to med rare....but we were also thinking that the rest of our meal would be cold by the time we called the server, sent it back, and have it come out again.  To our surprise, the server, AND the busser were completely nice, quick, and understanding.... they fixed the problem right away.  We got our steak back to perfect temperature, with new sides that we ordered fresh and hot.  Even the house red wine, was good..considering it was house wine.  I think it might have has something to do with the fact that they weren't cheap when ordering wine glasses because they were hand made and had no lip on the rim like a machine would do...I know.....  too analytical.   But it is what it is.  Overall, good quality steak, friendly service, with an amazingly reasonable price.  Would go there again with no questions asked.  mmmmmm....steak.

eRi1tFtC0wk96JRK6suMrg.text: My husband and I checked out Montana's Christmas day since it was very close to where we live. We had passed by many times, but never paid much attention, until we looked at the reviews.  We looked at the menu online and there were three things that caught my eye - scallops, lobster and of course steak. We had to go check it out!   What a wonderful dining experience! We were immediately seated. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food we ordered was delicious. Everything was cooked the way we wanted. We even received a complimentary canoli which happens to be my favorite dessert!  One of the best Christmas day dining experiences ever. Thanks Montana. We will definitely be coming back.

dC93n4QigQaSyBbCy2d07A.text: I love the Kolbe burger here! Of course I always have a vodka and cranberry with that too! ;-)

dYM1wDBQ_ihi1InHXFZ28A.text: Pretty good food for the price. Service is a little hit or miss at times, friendly but sometimes super slow. Nice atmosphere.

oZjBqs1Y4km7P_fIyKyiWg.text: Excellent meat, especially the chicken. Very reasonable prices. Really quiet. Booths and tables are small, people can get easily cramped.

9HAoqzYlCA0kEs81LZ4FJw.text: Great burger and the brownies melted in my mouth. Delish!!

sTxaXdl2rCaRYzquJ9UGnw.text: I love steak..especially when you tell a server "I don't really want you to cook it..just season it, maybe warm up a little?" and they DO! Every soup I've tried (clam chowder and tomato garlic) has been delicious...every steak served has been seasoned and cooked to my liking.  Calimari we had the other night was tasty and the dipping sauces that accompanied were even tastier.  I love this place- especially the fact that I can go and always find a table.  Don't dress up because its simply not required but- go hungry bc you won't leave that way.
