e-8NOAbPR7FINS_mkPv-BA.text: Ordered a kids grilled cheese, caeser wrap, and cheese burger. Only the kids meal came out after AN HOUR and the bread was toasted and the cheese still cold in between the two pieces of toast....apparently they don't understand the concept of grilled cheese. We were tired of waiting for our food after an extra thirty minutes from the grilled cheese, so we asked for the check. They had the audacity to try to charge us for the burger and wrap that we never received. I did call back the next day and received somewhat decent customer service from the manager that offered us to come back and get a gift card, but no thanks, not after that experience.

i9yBBVZhWpiggxfbDPzyDA.text: Can't say I like this place. Can't say I hate this place. Service is so so, and the grub is either hit or miss.  2.5

TYmMDDAz7eiGOL6OgYzDYw.text: This was our first New Years Dinner together being we worked on New Years Eve. We really enjoyed dinner and our Waiter and Hostess were great! But when we went into the bar and found 2 vacant machines..The barmaid very snotty reached out with her arms and said Sorry This Are Reserved!  You can share that corner Machine..We complained to the Manager and his attitude is Sorry Guys We reserve Machines.. It is what it is.. That's how you treat customers after they dropped over 100.00 bux for dinner and had another 100.00 a piece to gamble with in the bar...? "It is what it is" We won't be back! Nor will our Referrals!

fYhgiMN63NRgpxhtShGDIg.text: I took my sister here for dinner on New Years Day.  The staff was very friendly and atmosphere was better than most Las Vegas neighborhood restaurants.  Sis ordered the 7 oz Filet Mignon and baked potato.  She reported that it was one of the best filets she had ever ordered.......very tender and more than she could eat.  I ordered the Macadamia Crusted Chicken Breast after learning they were out of the Halibut.  It was tasty and just okay.  I hope they have the Halibut on my return visit.  I also had a glass of their house Cabernet Sauvignon......VERY GOOD!!  I know we'll put the Montana Meat Company on our list of favorite local restaurants.

Aes5gG5F6JXPmIH9N4TX9w.text: I like this place til I got a piece of metal in my food... I haven't been in over 2 yrs but craving it a little... I loved the lunch specials!!

1KHk2RzHG_ThRB8GJwITpQ.text: We order breakfast here routinely and are consistently pleased with the overall quality of the food, service, and especially the price! For two people,  breakfast usually costs us about $14.00 with generous portions of the entree and sides.  The atmosphere on the dining side is pleasant and dimly lit on the bar side of this establishment.  Our meals are usually take out, so I enjoy playing the poker machines while I wait for our order. I usually get lucky and win a few bucks too! The bartenders are always helpful and friendly and offer you drinks until your food arrives. All in all, it's a nice place for a quick tasty breakfast at a great price with very good service!

ighUyc014ZnWNYPw03RQEQ.text: My steak was cooked perfectly. The service was great. They were out of veggies but gave me a salad sub for no extra charge.

3sTdaEEu-svbvNNX7ryXlg.text: I have ordred take-out quite a few times from here.  The bartenders are always friendly.  I usually order the Kobe Big Sky Burger with Steak Fries.  They have great Ranch dressing for the fries so I can't  forget to mention that.  On several occasions I have enjoyed the Cajun Steak Pasta: Blackened steak medallions in a spicy tomato cream sauce.  Never dined here but To-Go orders have been a breeze.

09O3OpIVJXnMu97zc3hZqQ.text: Only a review for the breakfasts.  Been here twice now and very pleased.  Great value and good food.  Simple and limited selection, but good.

EInEaCiBCf3srTKpxE7wYQ.text: Wife and I came in for an early dinner. Server had limited knowledge of the menu and had to ask chef on at least 2 dishes.   Wife had BBQ pork and I had rib eye. BBQ pork and fries felt like they were microwaved. Rib eye was good but could have used simple salt and pepper for seasoning. Mashed potatoes were god awful and smelled like seafood, we didn't eat them.   Overall I thought Rounders was 10x better and right down the street.

Sp0h1RmZ_OoAZgv99hk_rQ.text: I've only been here for their graveyard special. They have a pretty decent selection of late night specials, and all so cheap. All of their breakfast items, excluding their steak & eggs are only $4.95, and the steak & eggs priced at $6.95. Also, they are having a special right now with 2 for 1 burgers.   I've driven by the place plenty of times, always intrigued by their cheap promotions. It wasn't until a month or so ago that I finally went in. Mainly because it's the closest 24 hour dining establishment to where I spend most of my nights.   Overall, it seems like a pretty decent place to chill and have a drink with your friends. The breakfast food was good for the prices, but don't know if I would necessarily eat any of their other items.   Service was kind of bad. But when my friends and I went, there was only one person working in the front of the house and he was busy with the people sitting at the bar. Also, the food took awhile to come out. It wasn't anything too bad, maybe I just have to go when there are more people working.

i4bbX6pakb9aTcsOKJFiPw.text: Lazerec is amazing !! Had no problem pulling items from the breakfast menu that I wanted for dinner !! Best chef you could ask for !!

b81MEsRPbhAkMqb6QnAeDA.text: I've been to Montana Meat Company a couple years ago and the food was good, so I decided to try their breakfast.  Advertised prices looked appealing.  Walked in around 10:00 AM and wanted to sit at the bar and have some breakfast.  Two patrons at the bar and no bartender.  Five minutes later, still no bar tender.  I looked around and there was no one anywhere else except for two other guys across the bar.  There was only a loud hacking cough coming from the dining room area.  Non stop disgusting cough.  The place smelled like smoke.  Not just your normal Vegas bar smoke smell, it smelled like they were using a few hundred pound of Marlboros to cure a frigging ham.  Pretty thick vomit smell too.  Seven minutes in, still no bartender or host, or waitress or anyone.  I left.

17wX_meTmzPge-JvCvnuwA.text: I really like this joint. They do a buy 1 get 1 burger special everyday. And all sandwiches discounted during lunch too. Their beer selection on tap at the bar could use some serious attention, however.

FHnUP9Wk1dCppGvfmV1gJQ.text: Very good steak but just realize that if you order medium rare you will get it! I am so used to restaurants over cooking the meat I always order it rarer that I like. They know how to cook it properly so order accordingly. I heard they have good breakfasts also so I went there early one weekend. The waitress was very spaced out like she'd had too much fun the night before and the breakfast just was ok. They have a good selection. I've brought all my out of town relatives here and they liked it too.

_SgQ1Sg2ce_HvVQyb6XvMQ.text: Had lunch with my Mom here last week.  It has been over a year since our last visit.  It is a restaurant/video poker bar.  The restaurant is on the left side of the building.  We were pleased to see that it was still kept well and clean.  Many video poker bars in Vegas go downhill rapidly.  After taking our drink orders, the server told us the Lunch Special was Buy One Burger, Get One FREE.  We decided to go for the Special and ordered a BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger and a Montana Peppercorn Burger.  After a short wait the server brought out our food.  I should have paid closer attention to the menu because the Montana Peppercorn Burger was served open-face with Gravy smothered all over the Burger & Fries.....not exactly what I wanted, but that was my bad.  Mom wasn't that hungry, so she was nice enough to trade with me....so I had the BBQ Bacon Burger.  The Burger was pretty good, not great....the Onion Rings that were served as toppings for the Burger were great.  The Steak Fries that came with the Burger were awesome.....they were cooked just right so that they weren't too soft or soggy.....which happens a lot with Steak Fries....they made it just right.  Mom couldn't finish the Gravy smothered Burger, so I had a couple of bites....I didn't really care for it....I'm not a fan of Gravy unless it's with Turkey & Stuffing.  I could barely taste the Peppercorn Burger under that Gravy and Grilled Onions.  Overall, it  was an ok lunch.  Will I return?  Yes, but not for the Gravy Burger.

3OKT_Imj14nYg2qFd7gXeA.text: Went in for a casual lunch and was very impressed with the quality of the burger I had. I love jalapenos and cheese. On a burger. Was second to Distill's though. Just can't beat burger stuffed with cream cheese with a plain Patty for me. Husband had a pastrami sandwich, was very happy with it. Neither of us are fans of steak fries, but they were fine as far as basic old fries go. Tried the place for dinner about a week later. My husband had a rib-eye and was very happy with it. My chicken Milanaise was flavorful and pleasing.

ahEanbPPhcJxdnTz1BzTWw.text: Pretty standard place as food comes.  It's decent but nothing to rave about.   I've been here on numerous occasions over the years since I live no less than a four minute drive away and there's always months sprawling between visits because when I eat here I never find myself eager to return.   Burger is fine.  Fries are fine.  Fish & Chips are fine but not worth $13, more like $8. Maybe $10 if they hadn't forgotten to include cole slaw as advertised, which I discovered upon reaching home with my order.  Desserts are okay. I came with a friend on one occasion after eating elsewhere to sample their desserts and we ordered about three to four items to taste a variety. Most of it was overly cloying, or tasted like it had come out of a box if that makes sense. (Like the brownie for the brownie sundae tasted like a microwaved Little Debbie bar? It was okay but there was that underlying almost plastic taste to it.)  Anyhow. Three stars. An okay rating for an okay place.

YdUQkPYuXObddlYL2jsa7w.text: UNBELIEVABLE!  From the service to the food!  My entire experience at this place was just that, unbelievable.    My husband and I live extremely close to the Montana Meat Company and decided to give it a try.  Every time we passed by there were always a ton of cars here and after reading all the 4 star reviews, it couldn't hurt, right?  WRONG!    We decided to do an early valentines day dinner here, so we went the night before so it wouldn't be too busy.  You would think we would have received excellent service but we sure didn't.  But let's start with the food.    I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, but wait, where were the artichokes?   There must have been 3 pieces in the entire dip.  Ok, maybe 4.  And I promise I am not over exaggerating.  The salads came out next, unfortunately it looked like the lettuce was browning and they tried to cover it up with way too much dressing.  And finally, the steak.  My husband ordered his steak medium rare, which he has been doing for years whenever he has a steak.  This steak wasn't even rare, it was RAW.  Now my husband eats almost everything and he never hesitates to eat a rare-medium rare steak, but after he cut into it, he stopped and stared at me.    We had to send it back and when the server brought it back rudely told my husband he should cut into it to make sure he was satisfied and stood there and watched him.  The service?   two thumbs down.   Service was sooooo slow and it seemed like a rather slow night.    Terrible experience.  I don't know how they're still in business.

G0P0KnnVyrefF8AZbrHgNg.text: Lady at the bar was not as professional as she should have . I asked her about the $2 charge for take out and she had no explanation. Also the beef was very very tough . $65 for to meals and the served me asparagus bottoms with no tips .

W_RejaGyLb8xILc9-kdEHg.text: Ok...I am giving this place 3 stars, because the service was terrible and most people at our table of 12 did not like their food.   I, however, did like mine, so I would come back with friends if they planned to come here. But since it is so far away, it won't be my suggestion.   Now, the strange thing about this place is to be called the meat co., you would think there would be many meat choices on the lunch menu.  Besides a roast beef sandwich and some medallions, everything else was chicken or fish. LOL!   I chose the Mac and Cheese with Buffalo Chicken, because of the suggestions on here...glad I did.  ****warning: there are strips of red onion in this, even though the menu made no mention of it.*** Anyway, after they re-cooked it without onions, and spit in it, I truly really enjoyed it. You could definitely taste the buffalo sauce, so it had a nice spicy flavor to the creamy cheese sauce. Nice chunks of chicken topped it off to yummy goodness. It was a nice sized potion, and comes with garlic bread (although mine didn't and I had to remind them to bring it).   I only wish had room for the calamari, because of the reviews on here...oh well, next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Re-made to perfection with no onions and a side if garlic bread.
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First portion with big onion strips. Ew!

XUswoBDgB2irUfzKfquNmA.text: It's a regular, Vegas bar. However, they've got amazing chicken fingers.  Sometimes I get a craving for spicy chicken fingers - no bones - and steak fries. It's so difficult to locate a spot that has both of these things and does them well.  Their chicken fingers are large, juicy pieces of meat that never have gristle or other bits to them, just high-quality white meat. Well sauced in a reasonable variety, they're quite good. Steak fries are steak fries, and that's half the battle!  Four stars because I've had a wrap here before that was not good, and last time they forgot the ranch with my to-go order. What are chicken fingers without ranch?!

avxImWk9BpBjCLdJqUUt4A.text: We had lunch today here. Our first visit today will not be our last. We loved it! The French onion soup and French dip sandwich were AMAZING  The lava cake and chocolate chip cookie with ice cream desserts were fabulous! The portions and prices were reasonable. It's nice to have a first class restaurant and bar in SW Vegas at Durango and Blue Diamond.

UHVamiUogppCkcJGdpb9QQ.text: Not only was the food amazing yesterday, but so was the service. Wes was our server and he was great.  Made the experience fun, while also giving us the best service, drinks were refilled without asking, etc. Today we went back in because a friend in our group left his credit card, and sure enough it was held in the safe. Reliable, great service and honest people. That's all you can ask for!

OA6WdAV87G4g2PvKS2_ZfA.text: Went there on a Monday night with family.  The restaurant wasn't busy, but our service was terrible.   I ordered the Macadamia crusted Halibut, and took like 3 bites and I couldn't eat anymore.  I didn't read the description close enough it had a lot of dijon mustard on it and it was very overpowering.  Our waiter came around and asked if I needed a box, and I just simply said, no thank you I didn't like it.  I expected to pay for it, it was my fault.  They were nice enough to remove it from the ticket.  It was my first time at Montana Meat Company, and I wasn't too sure about it.  That was super nice of them, so I will go back and try something new next time!

yTyShdN5thHraMI0TLeESQ.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I expected more from a place called Montana Meat Co.  It's bar food and it's absolutely horrible.  My son ended up getting sick in the parking lot. Everything tasted like it was from a can and extremely salty.  Never again!  Waste of time and money.

ijuW-8DX_VSwnZRvxUggMQ.text: Just called to place a to go order... Was asked if I could hold, I said no problem. Was on hold 15 min before I gave up. Called back and asked to talk with a manager but I was told there wasn't one there. Horrible customer service!!!  I'll be calling somewhere else to place my 5 person to-go order.

6OKjgwbXEpy7ZiJcpgntaQ.text: I was anxious to try this place  I had filet mignon and it was very good. Baked potato seemed like it had been cooked earlier that day and sat. Fair priced and service was very good. We had some kind of chocolate cake dessert with ice cream. It was good. This place is a bar/gaming place. Always there are separate glass doors to get to restaurant and separate door to the bar. This place doesn't have that which is strange so there is the smell of smoke that enters restaurant. This wasn't a problem for me but for my dining companion it was. We changed tables and they seated us in the back and that worked fine. I will return. Would like to try their breakfast. The menu for breakfast looked good. Also probably will visit their bar and gaming too.

81UkvAAI4d8XSX4ik6QDaw.text: I live at Mountain's Edge and enjoy a good breakfast with an Irish Coffee. No doubt Montana's has a good breakfast at a very reasonable price! I used to go into the restaurant with the lady a couple years ago. At first the restaurant was quiet then families started roaming into the facility. Sort of like a migration. A short time after the "migration", it got loud as these folks didn't have any regard for other patrons. They typically showed on the weekend. My guess is they probably just got done with their prayers to an invisible deity at their locale worship center. Right afterwards they opted for breakfast to feed the "commune". Trust me, they don't give a sh*t about others (there is a Mormon worship center very close). The lady no longer wanted to go to breakfast at this location - not relaxing.  At this point, I started going alone for a bit of personal time, but alas took my meals in the bar! Life suddenly got sweet again. Okay, this is where the 5-stars are warranted. The bar is kickass! One of the first things you notice is the iconic "leg" lamp from a "Christmas Story". That alone is worth a couple stars. Still, it is only so far a "leg" lamp can hold up a place. What in my opinion really makes this bar shine are my two regular morning bartenders, Emely and Wes! These two are pretty contrasting in nature, but both damn good on multiple fronts.   My advice for adults is dodge the restaurant and pop into the bar. If you got Emely or Wes tending, then just settle in and relax. If you catch Mark before he leaves shift then you are gold.  For the record, the bartenders at Montana's also wait tables. If you opt to roll the dice, then you might get lucky and have a stellar waitress/waiter with a quiet meal. For myself, I am not too much of a gambler. If I bet, it is on a sure thing ;)

F_YwX5tWYC_YVBSyxeLyUA.text: I really wanted this to be good and it just wasn't my husband's steak was barely seasoned and the vegetables were bland. My bacon wrapped scallops were burned it was just really bad all the way around. Slow service too

1pZpO3zhgft6E-qn7gf0NQ.text: Love this place! Cheap breakfast that's actually good. The sausage patty is the best sausage I've ever had. The Bloody Mary's are great too.  4 stars cause the service is kinda slow, and I've only had the breakfast.

f2wRWe7gBmKG0X4o-5F1ww.text: I've been to this location many times over the past several years.  Always good food and friendly service.  I'm happy that it is separate from the bar area which makes it a good place to take the family.

k0DjdfI5GNP8WwJ-f1S27Q.text: It was a nice experience. It was ok . Nothing to special. I guess I will come back if I'm hungry. Better bar then restaurant

R2R605IV2wE-v3PXKjMpTg.text: This "steak" is abysmal. While the menu is full of delicious sounding entrees, I Would definitely stay away from the ribeye special in the future. 2 dinners for 30 something dollars sounds like a great deal. And it is! If you don't mind the taste of low grade questionable beef sources.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

taYkuBYA6ChQ_FLVQRZsSA.text: Great local spot near Mountains Edge. I always get great service and food. Particularly bar tender Wes. He's always attentive and pleasant to be around. All around good experience.

8fVPq_ERcZFzDaPriwY_Qg.text: As always, dinner was terrific. I had the filet medallions with baked potaote and asparagus. Our waitress Cherlyn was attentive, and polite.

854G6DeJ8e_1akuAVdY1GQ.text: The food was alright. My GF ordered the blackened salmon and it was a little over cooked and the veggies were disappointing.  Mark the bartender was awesome though! 5 stars for him

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KfTR93EXxvYqSGhYO4UOlw.text: Just had an incident occur at the bar with an unruly customer who had a bit too much to drink, and the bartender, Wes, handled the situation very professionally. I don't know if I could have handled as politely as he did, especially after being called a homophobic slur and a racial slur. Problem was resolved quickly and without incident. Would definitely come here when he's working again because problems aren't that big of a deal. Good job on him!

Tmq7iB6u_sYFnslCe8dNmw.text: Never really came here during the day to try out the actual restaurant experience. But the graveyard bartenders are awesome, and right next to my house, nice place to have a drink after work. The cook is pretty good too, love the wings and chicken salad.

xkHvSN7mnpIP7GaGzBCLkw.text: My first time at Montana and it was delicious. Glad to have a bar close to home and find a new burger place to enjoy.   I had the Diablo burger which was more than enough and fries. My wife had the big sky and fries, everything amazing

oSSoT3Tkvax7KFzcqK99xw.text: Really disappointed in my last visit to Montana's meat company they're usually pretty good with their food and their service I don't know what went wrong this time but my to go order was good up into the point I made it to where I was going and discovered that my chocolate chip cookies were Burned I called to place a order the next day and to file my complaint about my cookies and I was told that it was nothing that they can do about it I was totally offended considering I'm a frequent patriot so make sure you check your food before hand

H4wL5kxGMwIPdN4nRaYvDw.text: Can't give it less because that's what they deserve. Got drinks, or soda and water and waited and waited and waited for 25 minutes.  Finally just asked for the bill for the drinks and left. Can't say it was bad service, just no service.  Asked for a wine list, was told they had a full bar. WILL NEVER BE BACK!!!!  I can stay in my car and get the same service.

d0HiUjDGMmjz4zx6PSSbtA.text: With so many big food chain option in this area, Montana Meat is a hidden gem.  Make sure you come hungry. And save room for the cow pie.

KjVeX7nGCEUPKJPlLtBKOg.text: My daughter and I had a great time here. The food isn't the best but the service and environment make up for it. Plus, their desserts are delicious!!! If you live in the southwest you should definitely give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops Appetizer
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo
Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids Meal: Top Sirloin Steak with Fries

HT_p6I2Edly1YWzo5Bl6IQ.text: My husband and I wanted to try out the restaurant. Our very first impression was the staff we saw really didn't want to be there.  We decided to give it a try anyway.  We ordered spinach and artichoke dip. It came and had NO FLAVOR.. We were nervous about our meal and how it would taste.. The French Onion Soup came and was VERY VERY VERY WATERED DOWN.  The menu said different.. We had them take away the soup and off our bill. The waiter didn't even seem to care. Our meal came. We tried one of their New Pasta dishes. The only thing with flavor was the Italian Sausage. The sauce tasted like thicker red water. The waiter never came to ask how things were but to give us our bill. We were leaving and then he asked if my husband wanted more coffee.  THE FOOD was TERRIBLE.  THE SERVICE WAS AWFUL!!

mcada3N_1R7KavHfeok1mw.text: Tried it since it was close to the house.  Service was friendly & good. I ordered the blackened salmon which was just ok.  I expected more for a $15 item.  I could have cooked this at home. The rice pilaf that came with it was good though, not overcooked as it can be with these places.  My son got the sliders which he was happy with. I'll give it another try. Maybe ill get their steaks next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I expected more for a $15 item.

Ixe--_M6iYAFu5nsMJjxLQ.text: Only giving 2 stars  this visit Food and dinner bread was off Service was awful from our waiter Matthew however most of the wait staff filled the gap so the overall was ok We eat here often and this is not a normal experience or food quality I will revise next visit

rSVoU-EvvDoyd4-EhdugNA.text: Today was our first visit to Montana Meat and it won't be our last! We all live close by; so there's no reason not to go back. My husband and I met and had a nice lunch with four of our friends; for an after Thanksgiving get together.  We all chose to have salads; with one person having breakfast. Food was served in a timely manner and portions were very generous. The waiter/bartender Wes; was so awesome! We all joked with him about his "multi-tasking" skills. He even took the time to check on us (several times) all while going back and forth from the bar, greeting/seating guests and serving.  His personality was very 'upbeat'; which made us feel comfortable. By the way... Wes even drew a special cartoon of himself on the top of the bill; riding a skate board with a top hat! Now isn't that showing a happy personality =) Hope to see Wes, when we visit Montana Meat, again!

wpJyHG9n9YmBXPuANttzRw.text: We were on our way to a little Japanese place down Durango but the construction traffic was pretty bad. Not wanting to inch towards our bento boxes, we pulled into the Montana Meat Co for some sandwiches instead.   Montana Meat Co is both a restaurant and a bar. We walked in to the restaurant part and were eventually greeted by the busboy, but we weren't really sure what job he had. You see, we had three different waiters tending to us over the course of the meal. More on that later.   The busboy/host/waiter sat us and took our drink orders. The bartender from the bar part of the restaurant eventually took our orders: club sandwich on sourdough and pulled pork with onion rings. The food came out quickly but we never saw the bartender/waiter again as service was taken over by a waitress. At least we guess it was taken over by the waitress as she never actually told us that. She spent the rest of the time just filling our water glasses.   The club sandwich on sourdough I ordered was served to me on white bread. The club was dryer than the temperance movement during prohibition. The pulled pork sandwich was served without the onion rings.   We would have told the waitress or the bartender/waiter or the busboy/host/waiter but no one came by to check up on us. "Service sucks," we said as we supped on our sad, somber sandwiches then split.   Next time we will sit through the traffic...

A2LXgInIcSJNs_UhTto7DQ.text: Terrible service. Food was priced decently but the service was terrible. From walking in and waiting for a host to the waitress not giving two shits about how we were doing, everything was half ass. And the food wasn't even very good. My chicken nachos were just a lot of chips and my girlfriend's French dip was so dry and hard she called it "tough". When you take your girlfriend out to a restaurant that specializes in good meats and she describes her French dip as being "tough" that's embarrassing. Not only for me but for the restaurant who should have an excellent French dip.  Bottom line: service was poor and food was not great.  Also, they grouped everybody together in only one part of the restaurant so we had people sitting there facing us the whole time easily able to listen to our conversation. Lazy service considering there was plenty of additional seating to spread everyone out  I will not return

A2q5iCxXKHpmlFNw02_ofg.text: I love coming to here for a good cocktail, plus it's close to my house. Came in for a drink after work. Received again excellent service from Cherlyn. The bartendar make the drinks on point & they are super quick. Very hospitable & checked on everyone at the table. They also remember us coming there. Great guys!!!   Atmosphere was nice. Not smoky at all. Great lighting in there. I also love their comfy booths. I like the nice touches throughout the place, with the art on walls & nice & intimate section in the back, my favorite booth :) .   As far as food, I really like their tuna Caesar Salad & Margherita pizza a lot. The have a really yummy deep fried cheesecake :)    THANK YOU CHERLYN. See you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks Cherlyn best cocktail ever

VeebJG_E7e8IWtZ4E1KN7w.text: I had breakfast with friends at the Montana Meat Company. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast. I has two boiled eggs, 8 oz. steak, fresh fruit, spinach and guacamole. It was delicious and I believe nutritious. I loved it that I could create my own breakfast. The decor was pretty. The food and service were good. I will come back to enjoy it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Montana Meat Company - Durango - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VcEakAohS6SflqTHQ5vIRQ.text: Called in an order for pick up and for the second time in just a few weeks was disappointed. Last time my order sat, and I sat, and it took longer than needed for us to find each other and for me to be on my way.   This time? I ordered the 20 oz ribeye. Picked it up. The steak, though thick cut, had none of the marbling associated with ribeye, was a far former cut than ribeye and appeared to be the sirloin. Took it back and rather than making me happy was told how the steak was just fine.   If I am not happy with it, it is not fine. There was no effort of any kind to make me happy, even to make sure I come back again. I cook my own ribeye and the steak I was given did not seem to be what I ordered.

eB__awcwIHC7MUkQSlHuxg.text: REALLY love coming here on the weekends for breakfast. Two suggestions to management: Can you please carry turkey sausage!? I can't eat pork and it makes my options limited. Turkey sausage/bacon would be so great for who don't/can't eat pork. Thad really all but also sometimes the door to the bar isn't closed and the smoke smell goes straight to the back of the restaurant. I know the bar is attached but the door is there! Other than that I love this place and the staff is always exceptional and the music is fun. Thank you!

sKh48XWQsAV9_dAcsJe2ww.text: My family and i come here about once a week and this is the first time that i felt i needed to say something.  It's usually hit or miss with this place but the last few weeks it's been a miss. My husband and i went for lunch and the same waitress/ bartender was there as usual.  The place was completely empty except for one other table.  And of course they say us next to them.  We ordered our usual lunch special but this time it was completely gross and different.  I complained to the waitress and all she said was that i must be wrong it's always that way.  Ummmm nope! Normally our burgers come with 2different melted cheese a heaping amount of mushrooms and fresh fries.  Today it came with cheddar cheese and 3 mushrooms.  It was over cooked and missing toppings that always come with.  She didn't care about my complaint,  she just decided not to come back to our table.  Horrible customer service and an overall horrible experience.  Won't be going back anytime soon.  Rounders here we come.  Please be better!!

xDpr8WbrBNiQjrB00QyWbQ.text: Just finished a late breakfast with my daughter here.  Menu was big and my Chili Verde eggs were delicious.  Only downside was that the bartender was the waiter and he was doing his best to work both sides but it was definitely to busy for 1 person but service was still good.

ErNVXQgxMSSOAfOAcEqS1A.text: Went here for the evening meal at Christmas. Took forever to be waited on, despite a sparse crowd in the dining area. The salad that my wife got had wilted lettuce. We sent it back - when the waitress finally made it back to the table. She asked what was wrong with it, never asked if she wanted anything else. Didn't see her again until our check arrived - about ten minutes after we were ready to leave.  At one time I was a frequent customer, but both the food and the service have really taken a dive since my last visit. I won't be going back.

CM26pS3x4vzKXqYmm1kPUg.text: Too lazy to cook your own steak? I know I am...so I come here. I've got to say, for a dime a dozen bar/restaurant this place has some quality food and lots of it.   Judging by the reviews, it looks like Montana Meat Company gets a lot of its business by being close to home for many. Same here. Just up the street so it's closer than Outback, and cheaper too. I've had some great steaks here and fortunately they've always been cooked to perfection. Each entree comes with 2 sides so you won't leave hungry. I ordered filet medallions and DAMN they were delicious.   Desserts are amazing as well...I suggest the cookie ice cream sandwich. The dining area is nice where you don't feel like you happen to be eating steak among a cigarette convention. But if you like that route, the bar area is cozy too with lots of TV's.   This is a Steelers bar FYI so don't be parading in there with your Ravens helmet!

iJEsDFZ47_p4hBxS_nBwfw.text: Had breakfast two mornings in a row while visiting the area. Great staff and excellent breakfast. It is supper cheap also.

TWN-Ig7VGsFJVQOlLN0wBQ.text: Horrible service!!! Nobody go here!   Me and a few friends went there the other night just for a few drinks. There was only ONE waitress which was also the bartender. All she did was id us, offered no menus, or take our orders 15 mins passed and we decided to leave. I'm still in awe.

l5GHDPISJpIaroLwhppFig.text: Food was mediocre. I ordered medium well and it came out well done. Not many choices for sides as far as vegetables. The service was bad. I asked the waitress if there were any other vegetables I could have with my order and she rolled her eyes and said no. I will not be returning.

iyAqV2howAc1j0FGVl93_Q.text: Don't be confused by the bar portion of this place; there is a restaurant on one side that serves food 24/7. This particular restaurant has its appeal, but falls short on the one thing it should be known for--the steaks.   I'm a harsh critic of steak places because I expect my meat to be cooked but it burned and tasting of blackened crust. Unfortunately, my steak tasted more like smoke and burn than anything. I ordered the ribeye and it was okay, but it wasn't seasoned. If it was, the burn taste overpowered it. The other thing that threw me off was the crust that forms on mash when it sits for a few minutes at the window. That turned me off.   I admit there is one thing that was okay, that being a lobster bisque. So, if you want to go for soup, head there. Otherwise, go somewhere else for a cut of meat.   I'll update this review in 6 months. I hope it improves with time.

EcAic6ayb6v6errYS7JFuw.text: For what it is, this place is great. Breakfast is excellent. Kobe burgers are awesome. Open 24-7.

XtT7X7JE6MImd4klqYm17A.text: We used to really love this place, but the last few times we were in, the service was fairly poor, and honestly I am not sure what is in the Jack Daniels bottle, but I know for certain what I was poured was not Jack.  I ordered a Jack on the rocks, and watched the bartender pour my drink.  What I tasted was not Jack, which I later confirmed when I went home and poured myself a Jack on the rocks from my bottle---completely different, which should not be the case since the liquor was poured with no mix.  Not cool.

dNBI6zQiUZWkG4QuhCjN5A.text: I went to breakfast yesterday ...I was so surprised how bad the food quality  went down ....it use to be so good .....If you want a good breakfast just go down blue diamond rounders ...

fG7hPp06xj31eiYkH2iqqA.text: I've been there about 6 times over the past year. The food is fantastic. The peppercorn burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had. The problem is the ambience and the service. The service is probably the worst I've had aside from the fact that they get the order right at least 75% of the time. They are a bit rude, bit without meaning to be. Very impersonal and don't really speak to you. They just drop the check on the table and walk away. They take your order and just walk away as they're writing it down without saying a word. The place is dark, quiet, and boring. Put a TV on the wall? I won't be coming back after this last visit, so I'll REALLY miss the delicious food.

LD3LOF_9EbgUWFsLCjZ_Mw.text: If you live in Mountain's Edge are and are craving some late night eats, this is your place. I have had much better bar food elsewhere, but the food here is quite satisfactory. The place itself is dark, clean, and doesn't smell of cigarettes and cigars usually. The drinks and food are fairly priced and there is a good selection. The breakfast starts at midnight and that is what I usually order. You can't go wrong with any of it. The burger with the jalapenos is delicious even if you are sober.

73t5WGn9IgDuVBXsQW0RAg.text: Today is my Son's birthday and this is our favorite place to eat for special occasions. We often frequent this establishment for dinner and occasionally for lunch. There's a sign clearly posted as you walk in "buy one get one free burgers" ANY BURGER. We were a party of 4 and we ordered 2 specialty burgers and 2 classic burgers. After waiting for what seemed like forever for our burgers, my husband's burger was not what he ordered. Our server was not who delivered our food and only returned to drop off the check and ask if we needed change. She also notified us that there's been a change in the burger policy. The buy one get one burger only applies to "regular" burgers and not specialty burgers. According to the bill, she didn't even discount the burgers that WERE eligible for the discount. I suggest you take your ANY BURGER sign down since you've decided to change your promo. Also, the server could have made that disclosure when we placed our order. When a table orders 4 burgers wouldn't that be more than obvious we were after your promo?   As much as we enjoy the food there, the service has become less than desirable. I think it's time to seek other dining options.

y-7ZF-fVNmCPwbyyyiypkg.text: I live nearby and have driven by a few times, tonight when nothing sounded good, we ended up at Montana Meat Co where everything sounded amazing. I ordered the Filet Stack, my boyfriend ordered the Chicken Quesadilla from the healthy menu, and both were divine. He said his tasted "healthy" but it certainly served it's purpose. I devoured mine, blue cheese encrusted filet mignon atop a garlic crostini complete with caramelized onions and a thick tomato slice...YUM. Service was good, attentive server (I think her name was Natalie) and support staff was on top of things. Prices are reasonable and atmosphere is tasteful and inviting. Will certainly be back!

yg7L9dE7mxpaipzwqO-_5A.text: Just went because my husband wanted to try it as friends had recommended. Honestly, one of the best steaks we have ever had. The 2 person ribeye special was incredible!! Our waitress, Christy was amazing! She was so nice, friendly and made our dinner feel like we were at a 5 star restaurant!! But then Montana is a 5 star reataurant. We will be a frequent diner to Montana! Thanks

jzFYht7PSPykB0XLp4bKDA.text: Went in 2008 and this place rocked,great service, perfect food.  Returned 7 yrs later and it was just pitiful.  I asked for the wine list and was brought a bowl of lemons, now thats just weird!  We laughed it off and finally ordered a bottle.  However, the waitress admitted she didn't know how to open it.  The filet was cooked a spot on medium, the lobster tail was very rubbery and way overdone like so many souls you see on the strip.  Better just stick with the turn here.

yKwyuTHUlKyMmAdEsTWt3g.text: Great food, great prices.  Never overly busy where I have to wait to eat.  The chicken fingers are the bomb.

xySr9lpimEjFhCuzHEkzog.text: This place is AMAZING!  We have had dinner here several times, and just had breakfast here for the first time. The service is excellent. Emily is fast, efficient, and super friendly!  We've never had anything less that outstanding service. The cook can actually cook eggs the way they are ordered.  The food is fresh and very tasty. LOVE this place!

BU1yZV230gdGmSDaF3ThxA.text: Charm in the neighborhood. We ordered one 12oz ribeye steak with 2 extra lobster tails, it was a very good portion to feed two people. Onion rings was yummy too! The server spilt our order to two plates I thought was very thoughtful. will defly come back again.

d5-tEGDYUBhjn9i4nINs8g.text: Our go to place for breakfast. The food is great and the prices are reasonable. The employees are nice and consistent in their service.

Db7owtecJggZ_cB0r7JmJA.text: The worst service I have ever experienced in my life.  The food is average, and the workers are far below average.  Every server and bartender there has been rude.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

D5ZKMaN0RmM7JYKm4KKPkg.text: Las Vegas is not a place for great food, but it's great fun. If you are looking for a really good steak dinner, you couldn't do better than visiting the Montana Meat Company.   In fairness, it's about a 20 minute drive away from Las Vegas, but well worth the trip. It's very friendly and inviting, spotlessly clean and with steaks to die for - if that's your thing! If you are a dessert person, prepare yourself - theirs are about 3 times the size of ours and just can't be done. When they show you what there is, you think you are looking at the whole thing, but it's a portion!   It is a drive away and a pain if you don't have a car. Not sure how much a cab would cost, but if you are looking for a great meal, pay it a visit.

M_larfxELfkRMCu5Bd0eow.text: Five stars for service! Been here a few times with my boyfriend and Lauren has been nothing short of amazing! Food aside, it is always the service that draw customers back! We will visit again and again, only to see our girl Lauren!

bshXBDUqLKhpeNHnibO5NQ.text: Well, living down in the SW Las Vegas area doesn't leave much to do because it is so new and everything is still catching up to us. With that being said, Montana Meat Company is only 1/2mile from our house and we enjoy walking... yes I said walking to this establishment (walking to a place in the SW is almost unheard of right now). Most of the time we are there to hang out at the bar, but the dining are is very nice. A bit dark and a lot of leather. The decor is right out of a cattle ranch minus the manure smell. I like it! Along with the good food, is a good staff. We have gotten to know some of the workers and everyone is so nice! The bar area is cool. About 6 plasma TV's for sports and they serve one of my favorite brews... Anchor Steam! The food is really good. I have been here MANY times and I have only had to send one thing back ever... The Steaks are obviously their trade mark and the main attraction on the menu (montanameatco.com/menu.h...), and they are very good. The prices are not too bad either for a steak dinner. We have also had a lot of their "Bar Food" selections, and I have no complaints. Everything is Hot and Fresh, and just like Iyrne B. said, the portions are a nice size. I was going to give this a 3 Star review because the bar is a bit small and cramped, but I remembered it was also a STEELERS bar on game day... Can't go wrong there! Cheers.

fAn8KldikDb0fcpcTb_ixQ.text: I tried calling 3 times before getting a hold of Scott, the manager who was on duty that day. When I told him I got food poisoning from the chicken he acted like it was my fault for not noticing it was under cooked and eating it. He also told me I should have called sooner. When I told him I had tried calling multiple times he said it was impossible as he had been there and available every day. He was extremely rude and wouldn't even apologize. He said he would make sure the kitchen cooks the chicken thoroughly next time. I won't hold my breath.

hQtLW_P79rB3jrOnrslm8A.text: Food bad, service worse. Don't bother

aW9H0_eP30V4phASD7r4Wg.text: This is a great local neighborhood restaurant and is one of our "go to" restaurants close to home.  The food is always great - except the veggies which are a pretty boring mix - sorry!!  The lamb chops are awesome and the basil and honey dipping sauce rocks!  Mark is the best server and always takes care of us.

Txe69Lgga1VZPUt4ogqbTg.text: Just like the Centennial locaion, this is an above average NW answer for a steakhouse. Having actually lived in Montana, the decor is pretty consistent of what you can expect there. The meats are good. Not Monatana fresh, but still definitely above average. Portions are nice size, service is quick and friendly and atmosphere is that of a Montana log restaurant, which is pleasant.  Nice neighborhood 24 hour restaurant/bar.

WBJFrz-xzW-dxEaATGYEow.text: I love this bar/restaurant . I have been coming here for over 2 yrs. That"s why I didn't expect to be treated the way my friend and I were treated last week by the bar tender named Grace.I come to this establishment 4-5 times a week, usually in the morning. On this particular day, friday the 22nd, my  friend and I were there for about an hour after work. We both lost about 40 bucks a piece on the machine which was not a big deal. I had a cheeseburger and my friend had a calamari and we both has 3 beers a piece., I left Grace $20 which I thought was enough to cover the food my friend and I ate. We were leaving and Grace out ruuning and yelling at my friend saying that she owes her money and had the bill that was 10 something dollars . She went after my friend like we were trying to run away from our bill. This is a bar that I go to almost every freaking day! We were already out in the parking lot and Grace is shoving this bill on my friend's face saying that the $20 bucks I gave her was not enough to cover our food!! I and my friend have been humiliated in our lives as much as that time. I gave her $20 bucks more . I learned later on that she told her manager that she had a problem with me and told the manager that we did not even play the machine. People like Grace tarnish an excellent establishment like montana. I have had a Grace experience in this establishment ever since I started coming here except for when Grace is there. So I highly recomment this bar to any friend's I have . But now I tell them not to go there on thursday, friday and sunday mornings. which are the days that Grace works.

9vYMFeTOaaL_qC9NKazm_Q.text: I was intrigued by the 2 for 1 Burger and Fries special and after reading a few Yelp reviews that the burgers were really good, I decided to try it out with my family.  Good and Bad.   The Good - The burger was one of the best I have ever had.  Amazing flavor.  Seasoning was spot on.  The bun was terrific.  Just a flat out awesome burger experience.   The Bad - The fries were cold.  Not just my regular ones, but my wifes sweet potato fries as well.  I wish I could say this was the biggest issues but it wasn't.  The service at this establishment was absolutely horrific.  Not in a rude sense but slow like watching the grass grown for hours.  The server had zero personality.  It took a while to get him to come over.  We asked a question about the burger special which must have been what put him in a crappy mood.  "Oh, great, more 2 for 1 people with no money."  Now, I was formerly in the hospitality business for over 18 years and am a serious over tipper.  I do because I served and tended bar for years and know that you live off of gratuity.  The food comes and luckily we did need anything during the meal because we never saw the server again.  We had to aggressively plead the busser to get us a Coke refill.  It took nearly 15 minutes to get the check.  I swear I almost walked out.  I probably should have.  Needless to say I did not leave a very good tip since it certainly wasnt deserved.  I should not have left any gratuity but I just cant bring myself to do that.  I know, that is just plain stupid.    I doubt that the management group of the Montana Meat Company is keeping an eye on Yelp to make sure that they are getting reviewed well so I doubt this situation will change much.  If they were reading consistantly, I doubt I would have had the experience I did.    So even though this burger was killer,,,, it is still not in the same league as BJ's bar and grill off of Valley View near the 215.

pDuAZGxQey_y7Vzr6Yns4A.text: I've never had a bad meal! We order take out all the time because we can have an amazing dinner in our home, and it's usually ready in about 15 minutes! You have to try their burgers with the Kobe patties, amazing!! I also recommend the bacon scallop appetizer. If you're eating it, the service is great. Even the chef comes out to help. Love this neighborhood gem.

NSvbC2rInfCFVMQICKvYsw.text: Great service, steak was a little tough and stringy but the taste was great. Great little neighborhood restaurant and bar.

iR5QbpIRSh5Xh1X-jCbtpg.text: Ok, I've only been here for breakfast but they've got killer deals for breakfast.  I've had the steak and eggs and chicken fried steak.  The steak is a flat iron and cooked perfectly.  The hash browns are more like seasened fries. The chicken fried steak was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.    I do agree that the service is hit and miss.  One of these days I'll return for a ribeye steak for dinner.

gzRdgzn2MS_rBDhzs_Eu4A.text: I go here all the time as you just can't beat the 2 for 1 burger special. You don't need to splurge on the Kobe burger as the Classic Big Sky with cheese, bacon and mushrooms (with steak fries) is large, filling and always great. It's always the same, very friendly, wait staff and it doesn't hurt that it's so close to home if you live in or around Mountains Edge.

BU032T79yZOvur4YmAi5tg.text: This is a place I tried out of convinience.  I was very happy with my decision.  The menu is pretty simple, although has unique dishes.  It has great relaxed athmosphere and great prices.  I got the Kobe beef sliders, the sliders were perfectly cooked along with great crispy fries.   We also had the honey mustard chicken with the bacon, chedar cheese and mushrooms. Which was moist and came with a great baked patato.  The only negative thing I had was the waiter, but I think that can be avoided and doesn't have anything to do with the food.  Hope you enjoy this place too.

HoN1m1ssu_U8-eiHNUxeBw.text: The food here is good, but not great.  As I posted before any place that has a 24hr-gaming tag attached to it sure makes it hard to get excited about.  I always here that some have really good food, but can't convince myself to go knowing it will be mostly just a bar.

o0-wsc4saTOXvq6l-pOXeQ.text: My family lives 5 minutes from Montana Meat Company and I'm so happy it is that convenient.  My daughter is in love with their breakfast and my my husband is in love with their burgers.  Living out in the southwest without many options, glad this is one of them!

wIWyOr-mrCwm9fRJc3dvSQ.text: If you live in the Southwest (Mountains Edge) this should be a quick, easy and cheap breakfast for you on the weekend before you start your day. I mean really $4.95 for a full on breakfast?... i have had almost every breakfast offering they serve and i think the chicken fried steak "The Range" has to be my favorite to date. Service seems to be on point when i have rolled through and i have even tried the lunch specials $5.95 for all sandwiches, wraps, and salads... i went with a turkey wrap and was tasty with the thin crunchy fries. Hard to beat such a cheap meal literally a few blocks from my house. Check it out if you have passed it on your way to/ from work back to the house as its not a bad spot at all.

chxHnUaaqk3Z3iLPmA3F7g.text: I agree with the review written by martinez b. Grace is the worst bartender ever!!! She is lazy and treats all her customers with disrespect. I stopped going to the bar just because of her attitude. Someone let me know when she finally gets fired so I can start going there again.

X2kzwysrwAtAeneDgtrRAQ.text: Great food. Great service. Great Bartenders. A must when family or friends are in town. Thanks it's nice to have a local place to go that you are always treated like a winner.

IXtzkjkzDrOdvNrKqSSKAQ.text: We always come for the $4.99 breakfast. The food is decent and the people are always friendly. The big complain I have is the wait. It takes them 15-20 minutes just to take our order and another 30 minutes to prepare them. I'm not sure if they are understaffed or if the servers are just slow. If they would just improve the service I would give them 5 stars.
